We had a coffee there every morning, and each coffee was consistently good! Their iced coffee was also exactly how I like it, and not overly sweetened like Starbucks!
If you're ever in the area, this is definitely the best place to get coffee!

reviews: This is the perfect quintessential neighbourhood espresso and coffee shop.  When I bring friends to The Beach and/or Toronto, I always bring them here. It speaks for itself. Whenever I travel outside of Toronto and have espresso at other far flung locales, I realize some of the best espresso simply comes from my own neighbourhood in the Beach. The shop emulates everything that is so wonderful and soulful about this neighbourhood. Just simple good wholesome espresso. No gimmicks here.

You would think if you saw a customer standing out front that you would take 30 seconds out of your day to let them know when they can come in.

i will not return

name: Dave Power

Jim,
I apologize for the late notice in getting back to you.  I am sincerely sorry for everything that happened on that morning.  There is no excuse for any of it.  I would like to offer you a $20 gift card to make up for the inconvenience and the way you were treated.  Please let me know if you would accept this and I will leave it for you with our staff. Again, I am deeply sorry.
Best,
Sarah

reviews: Really good pour overs, super friendly staff and fresh baked goods. Really close to the beach so you can always tale it to go and enjoy a nice walk. The setting is really nice and everyone that comes in is super nice.

name: John Orzel
reviews:
I feel like the Beaches are purposely keeping Bud's under wraps and not letting anyone know about this spot. I had no idea about Bud's and was dreading of finding a good cup in a new spot. With the overwhelming positives for this spot, I stepped into their door and was happy to Sam James beans being used.

Recently, it sounds like they moved to a bigger spot and still making a great cup. It is still very busy... even on a lazy Saturday afternoon, there was no tables freed up and the constant line up was in and out of the place. It has a great friendly vibe and everyone here is quite warm with each other. It's clear that Bud's has made themselves part of the community because of the number of personal conversations between patrons or the staff and patrons. This was really nice to see. I guess Toronto can be friendly after all!

I have to appreciate how they use the good Canadian brands like Pluck and Cut Coffee to create their drinks. Nothing like supporting a good local. I think the baristas really know their drinks cause the flat whites we got were surpassing some of the well known coffee shops that sit on Toronto top 50.

Flat White with almond milk - The butter knife beans are just so good and Bud's did them right. This was a rich and robust coffee flavour with a touch of milkiness from the microfoamed milk. No acidity to make me wince. We decided to do the cashew and almond milk side by side taste test. I personally liked the almond milk more. I found it didn't influence the flat white as much and let the coffee flavour be more forward. I liked this one. 4/5

Flat White with cashew milk - I found the cashew milk version to have less of a coffee flavour... it definitely changed the taste. I would say it was a milkier flavour but more muted for sure. I did find cashew milk to be creamier than the almond milk but also weirdly enough, I touch more sweet? So if you're looking for the texture the most closest to cow's milk, this would probably be your favourite alternative milk. Kudos to Buds for offering more than one type of nut milk. 4/5

If I'm far out east again, I'll definitely make Bud my choice to get a good flat white and happy I'm not stuck to Starbucks.

Had a v60 drip, cappuccino with oatmilk, cheddar and chive scone and ham and cheese croissant. The pastries were heated up and great! Drinks were also good. Will be back to try more! There is seating inside and outside too.

name: John Metaxas
reviews: New fav spot! I‚Äôm obsessed with their fredo cappuccino with crema. It‚Äôs just like the coffees I would drink on my vacations in Greece. The place is brand new and clean. The staff are professional and the manager was very helpful! Highly recommend if you‚Äôre in the area, and even if you‚Äôre not!

name: Christine Lynn
reviews: The espresso here is fantastic, it's is perfectly bitter, smoky and delicious. The service is friendly, polite and knowledgeable. The establishment is always clean and the environment is welcoming.

name: Jonathan de la Cruz
reviews: Such a fun experience..staff was incredible!!!!

name: Peter Raftopoulos
reviews: Good coffee. Great croissants. Must try!

name: Julia Henderson
reviews: Ice coffee was so good üëç great service too

name: Jeremy Mark
reviews: Luv this Cafe. They have a good selection of coffee to enjoy. Of course, service was excellent and cool. Another place to go to replace my Starbucks addiction. You need to give this place a try. Can't wait to come back.

name: nikolas filice
reviews: Very good espresso drink. This is what espresso needs to taste like.

name: Jose Vieitez
reviews: Amazing staff and great coffee!!

name: Negar Shahrokh
reviews: What a beautiful little spot! So many coffee options. The coffee and pastries were very good.

name: Kevin
reviews: I‚Äôm obsessed with this place! They have a cool interior design, professional and friendly baristas, and the best filled croissants! So far, I‚Äôve tried their Turkish coffee (they call it Greek coffee in the menu), banana walnut croissant, and pistachio croissant. My favorite is the banana walnuts so far but I‚Äôm going back to try other ones as well. The only issue is that their roasted beans are slightly overpriced but I like that they sell them in sealed reusable bags.

name: Dave
reviews: Friendly and attentive staff, a wide variety of coffee, and the option to buy niche and interesting coffee brewing devices. The selection of coffee, along with the variety of brewing techniques, make this a must visit cafe on it's own, but the baristas truly made the experience for me. After a small problem with one of the machines, the barista remade my coffee 3 times until it was up to par, and went out of his way to ensure he made me the best cup of coffee possible.

name: Matthew Lothian
reviews: The espresso taste is really good. The croissant was delicious too. Nice decor inside and plenty of patio space outside. Friendly service.

name: Carla C
reviews: Great place for a quality coffee, friendly chat and bite to eat.

name: Dd 88
reviews: Lovely staff!

name: Geoffrey L
reviews: Cute little coffee shop! Kinda small but they got a great selection of coffee. I got the matcha latte and I have no complaints.

name: Alin S.
reviews:
Great neighborhood place, knows their regulars, and decent food options to go with your coffee. There's a lot of people here during weekends but the staff are really quick so there's not a lot of waiting time.

Most likely pet friendly. Very often you'll see dogs just outside, and on the odd day you'll spot a small cat in a trolley

name: Quarrington Z
reviews: Best croissant ever!

name: Jay Canada
reviews: Unfortunately, this cup of single origin americano was over-extracted. Grinds are too fine and there are coffee bean sediments at the bottom of the cup. Also, over-extraction caused the coffee way too sour and astringent, undrinkable . For a $4.5 americano, I hoped it is at least decently crafted. However, I consider this to be an isolated event and would try again next time.

name: Federico Huffmann
reviews: Great coffee place

name: Fetiye Aydƒ±n
reviews: Fantastic coffee, fantastic beans. Too bad specialty coffee is seasonal. Would have wanted to have some of their offerings year-round. It's excellent.

name: Tanja G
reviews: Great atmosphere

name: Varun Wadhwa
reviews: Cute, edgy little coffee joint on Bay St. ‚òïÔ∏èSuper friendly (and cute) staff üòú Was very happy to see a flat white on the menu board üôåüèº Moderately to high priced for the coffee, but it was delicious and worth every penny. Plus nice to be supporting a small, local business üòä

name: Ricardo Porter
reviews: I tried a cortado because I wanted to taste how well the espresso shot was pulled and I was not disappointed. Great technique in preparing and pulling the shot and milk was the perfect texture and temperature. Will be back.

name: Sonia Cacoilo
reviews: Great Job.

name: Jun Bang
reviews: Best coffee in the area hands down!!

name: Galawej HB
reviews: love the service and quality of this place. the barista I spoke with was very friendly with explaining different brewing methods and her recommendation for me blew my mind. I will defin come back here to try different brews.

name: Will Beekman
reviews: I ordered coffee and scones. I liked their coffee, atmosphere, and location. The owner and the staff were very friendly with good customer service. However, their scones were not fresh/ they were stale...Overall, it is a nice place with a great coffee selection.

name: Kari McLaughlin
reviews: Awesome selection, great setup, and very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Will definitely return.

name: Jennifer Likof
reviews: Coffee was great . Love to visit here . Will surely visit here again

I tried their hot and iced chai latte and I loved them both! My friend attests to their great quality coffee (both in drinks and beans). Their pastries are fine. I had their almond croissant which was good but overpriced. Great service.
Overall, great to grab coffee from or hang around in.

name: Shayan Sohail
reviews: This is the place for spanakopita and tyropita (spinach and cheese pie)!

name: Nicole Brown
reviews: Good vibe of this place. Spanish latte highly recommended

name: Sara Ameri
reviews: Great coffee & amazing almond croissants!

name: Elizabeth T.
reviews: Can't say how the coffee is since I never got to order anything despite waiting in line for 10 mins. The barista was chatting up with a customer while very slowly preparing the order. The other baristas were just idly looking around and at me waiting in line but none of them seemed willing to take an order. I was in a hurry so I just left and got my mid-day coffee somewhere else. Not bothering with this place again.

name: Oliver Belfield
reviews: Great service from nice staff. Interesting collection of roasts and beans, and ways to brew them. Can use Ritual to pre-order.

name: Anupama Sharan

name: Alexander Cappellazzo
reviews: After walking past this place on my way to work each morning, I decided to stop in for a latte. Milk was so smooth, espresso extracted perfectly. One of the best lattes I‚Äôve had in a while!

name: Parastaar Sutaria
reviews: I have only been here once but I am giving a 5-star rating for this place being so pocket friendly while delivering great and artisanal coffee experience.

name: Matthew Bickford
reviews: If I were lost at sea and stranded on an island, I really hope it's Coffee Island.

name: Tejasvee Prasad
reviews: Lovely experience, a variety of coffees available including flavours and methods. Very patient and friendly service as well. A must try.

name: Moataz El Ayadi
reviews: The service was perfect, they have so much coffee and great food you can try! Super recommended

name: Manuel Mora
reviews: Found Coffee Island by doing a Google search for coffee shops near the hotel I was staying at. I intended to get take out only, but it was so cute that I ended up sitting in for a little while. I got a drip coffee and a flavoured croissant, and they were both very good! I noticed that the staff knew a lot of the regulars‚Äô names and orders, and helped someone purchase whole beans as a gift. Overall, a great experience at Coffee Island!

name: Camila Ponte
reviews:
I loved the coffee. I tried the Sumatra. I had never had Syphon coffee and was very impressed. They have 4-5 different brewing methods. The baristas are pretty knowledgeable as well.
The croissant was whatever, I would say stick to the coffee, don't bother with the food.

name: Julia Pugach
reviews: The coffee here is amazing, they offer different coffee blends from different countries. The brownie cookies are fantastic, and the place has a great design.

name: Alex Frias
reviews: Quick service, warm and cozy atmosphere and the tastiest coffee in town I've had so far! Starting from today - my #1 destination for a cup of cappuccino))

name: James Kruk
reviews:
Some rude/unpleasant staff. It was my first visit. I was just asking about their products and learn about their original coffee. It seems they were not too enthusiastic or customer friendly for that matter. Never coming here again. Their regular brew was mediocre, but price was reasonable.

Overall decor and atmosphere was pleasant.

name: Sentayehu Berihun
reviews: Great coffee, great service, great environment.

name: Emil Jayatileke
reviews: Employees seem nice, food looks good, didn‚Äôt get to try it though. Being offered outside seating like a dog didn‚Äôt feel right, due to a friend‚Äôs medical condition. I remember when peoples private lives were private!

name: Salim Bamakhrama

reviews: I visited Coffee Island for the second time and when I walked in, barista (tall girl with curly hair and glasses) was sweeping the floor and without washing hands started taking my order. This coffee place also has a lot of very tasty pastries. You should check it out!

Great coffee, fast service, welcoming environment. They support tap payments and Ritual. Their service overall gets better each day. Fantastic

name: Andreas Tassis
reviews: I live in Greece which is where the first Coffe Island started and with me living in the centre of Athens im surrounded by Coffee Island shops.Years ago I went to a Coffee Island for the first time with a friend where I got a cold chocolate with strawberry flavor and since then that's the only thing that I've been purchasing from that chainsaw for years.I highly recommended to buy cold chocolate with strawberry flavor since it's to die for but idk if they will make it the same in Toronto

name: Simon DDN
reviews:
Unreasonably rude staff.
Don‚Äôt even go there unless you want to ruin your mood .
Don‚Äôt recommend !!!

name: Kelly Da Silva
reviews: Excellent service, with immense knowledge of coffee willing to help you to make your own choice

name: Shim Mannan
reviews: The environment here is really unfriendly. I was translating for a friend and the staff seemed annoyed with us. They were completely uninterested in answering questions we had about the menu. Admittedly, the coffee selection is impressive as are the modes of preparation.

name: Lee Balki
reviews: Long time customer here.  I've probably spent over 1,000$ here as I live 1 minute away.  I ALWAYS support small business over Starbucks and Tim Hortons so would support this place whenever I could.  Their prices are more than Tim's or Starbucks but again, I don't care as I prefer to support small businesses and would rather support the local community. However, I dealt with a disgustingly rude staff member a few weeks ago and will never be attending this coffee shop again.

name: Jesse DAndrade

I ordered a light roast and the staff secretly pumped medium roast into the cup, probably because the light roast had run out... (at 9:45 in the morning?).

reviews: I've been there twice. The coffee is good, the place is beautiful, but the lady who prepares coffee is a little rude. I don't feel comfortable been attended to by her. I love coffee, I go to coffee shops frequently and, I can say that it's not common to see baristas like her.

name: NihilistsRUs
reviews: Hands down one of the best places to get coffee in Toronto. They have an amazing selection of single source java and the taste gets me every time. Not too sour or bitter, just the right balance that doesn't make you acidic:). Oh, and their chocolate almond croissant- the best I've had in Toronto

name: Hayley Mauritis
reviews:
This is a cute little place on the Bay and Wellesley corridor and they have really nice staff! We were on a fall walk and didn't carry any credit cards on us. We had recently activated google pay (so, we weren't sure if it would work or not).

We told the lady at the counter to try charging us first to make sure it went through - and she was like "that's fine, you guys obviously live in the area - you can drop by and pay later if it does not work"

Our payment worked :)

Very genuine and friendly customer service - that's really difficult to find these days. Kudos to their staff!

The coffee was great. They also have flavored hot chocolate (my wife tried the strawberry one - it tasted like the red quality street chocolate, for the one's who know it!)

Great place. Do check out if you are in the neighborhood.

name: Kev N
reviews: The coffee and espresso is so flavourful and delicious. The croissants are buttery and light - among the best I‚Äôve had in the city. The staff are so warm, knowledgeable and friendly making this my favourite cafe in TO

name: Mario guerra

Huge range of coffee beans and coffee methods at reasonable pricing.

name: Lambros Galanos

name: Tim Pollock
reviews: Hello Nicholas! We really appreciate you taking the time to give us your review. We have mentioned your experience to our team to figure out what could have gone wrong, but please feel free next time to mention anything that falls short of your expectations to any available staff member so we sort it out right on the spot. Hope we have the chance to meet you once again at our coffee shop. Good day!

2020.08.30. The afternoon walk was on Bay Street North. This time had a "Turkish Coffee" prepared in hot sand at "Coffee Island". This was my first "Turkish Coffee" since 9th of August 2020. It was a strong good coffee.

Anyways, always crowded. It‚Äôs great that they have outdoor seating, and it‚Äôs dog friendly but unfortunately the way the building is built creates a massive wind tunnel. So it‚Äôs always very windy when sitting outdoor during the summer.

Overall, the ambiance is great, prices are reasonable, and my experience is always positive.

name: Freya
reviews:
I‚Äôm not sure why this place is rated this well given how terrible my experience was. I came in looking to have an iced mocha - a very typical drink available in most cafes; but I suppose not here.

As I was asking if it was available and told no by the person at the counter, i said can I order hot mocha with ice. He said sure; but then out of nowhere the owner (or manager?) maybe in the most patronizing tone told me that it‚Äôs very important to know your drink and that the only way to make an iced mocha is by making it an ice blended drink. She continued on saying that "you need to trust us on this; how else would you make an iced mocha if not to blend it with ice ". I held off my thought since I really didn‚Äôt  want to make any scene there; but FYI ma‚Äôam; people have been making iced mochas since forever. In my mind also, what kind of a cafe would this be with this kind of manager/owner. Even another customer next to me said in front of an employee that she‚Äôs had lots of iced mochas in other cafes.

So I went on to order and iced latte and was asked if I wanted to add a chocolate shot in it; and I said why not. But I got the drink and realized wow - I now kind of understand why; this was possibly the worst "iced latte" I‚Äôve ever had in my life. I‚Äôve been drinking coffee since I was 6 so I know a thing or two about the drinks; and that was by no means an iced latte. I think McDonald‚Äôs iced coffee might have been a better choice.

The only salvation for this place was the nice little patio it has with good internet; but that‚Äôs about it I‚Äôd say. I‚Äôd not be coming back - that‚Äôs for sure

name: Scatha Smith
reviews: Hello S Bear, we really appreciate you taking the time to give us your review. We‚Äôre very sorry to learn that you didn‚Äôt enjoy your mocha as you wanted. We always strive to offer each one of our guests a unique coffee experience and we reassure you that our store manager wanted only to help you having a great coffee. Our team would be more than happy to welcome you once again at our coffee shop and treat you with the coffee that suits best your taste preferences. Good day!

Would have been tastier if it was served hot I think :)

name: U P
reviews: Great location, exceptional service but the overall product is underwhelming for a near $8. London fog barely had a hint of bergamot - might have well just ordered steamed oat milk.

name: Amanda Nguyen
reviews: A lovely coffee shop!

name: Moe Emami
reviews: Mediocre

name: Dianne Castro
reviews: Great and fast service! Had a Chai Latte for the first time here and really enjoyed it :)

name: Secret Reviews
reviews: Best iced vanilla lattes in Toronto! The rest of their menu is also fantastic.

name: nbolum01
reviews: nice place

name: Michael Wies
reviews: Friendly staff, not too busy, good espresso and couldn't be more convenient in the financial district. Downtown Toronto prices, but not exceptionally high.

name: Vic DL
reviews: Best coffee ever!

name: Bryn Nihill
reviews: My only complaint is how busy this location is, a great sign that they know what they are doing. My spectacular coffee was the other indicator.

name: Marc Leckman
reviews: Beautiful space and delicious coffee

name: Archit Chitnis
reviews: Great location and setting. Good capuccino

name: Sailesh Kumar
reviews: One of the best coffee shops in the vicinity

name: Tiff Lee
reviews: Smoothest flat white I've ever had with super courteous and personable service! One of the best coffees I've had in a long while!

name: John Turley-Ewart
reviews: Great coffee! Great staff!

name: Khaled Zaky
reviews: My go to morning espresso when I am in the financial district. This is espresso made with love and quality. There menu has a lot of amazing pastries, desserts and things to nibble on and complement my espresso. What I appreciate the most is the consistency in quality. Lots of coffee shops spin up and the quality winds down over time. Dineen raises the bar every time. This location has wifi and seats for those who want to work or even order some afternoon drinks (yes liquor is served here), I am more of a coffee guy though.

name: Mohit Gogia
reviews: Great spot for a coffee or a beverage.

name: Shannon T
reviews: Super cute open area cafe in Commerce Court (under CIBC) in Financial District. Actually reminds me more of a bar than a coffee spot! Drinks are extremely standard, but would definitely come back for a date or a coffee chat.

name: Christian Anastasiades
reviews: Good but very busy

name: Adrian Nicola
reviews: Delicious oat milk latte.

name: Zarwah
reviews:
Good cappuccino. The drink was well made and tastes authentic.
The chocolate croissant was nothing special. I recommend passing on the baked goods as this is the third item I have tried at Dineen that tasted like packaged baked goods. Not bad by any means but not worth the price.

Disappointed but cognizant that it is the Financial district so items everywhere are always a little marked up.

Ambiance is lovely and the decor is definitely nice! Good place for meeting a client or friend!

name: S Tam
reviews: Ok spot for catching up

name: Hilary Keffer
reviews: Just a regular coffee shop

name: Steven Taylor
reviews: busy, vibrant with decent coffee.

name: Sheldon Maze
reviews: Not as good as the original location, but good coffee and a nice location. It's often busy, but we were able to find a seat have have a good conversation, not too loud either. I would not pick this place for work, too much foot traffic during the week.

name: Andrew N
reviews: Love the coffee and love the treats. Location is awesome and the added seating on the side is great for impromptu meetings. Service is top notch!

name: Jonathan Ng
reviews: Best coffee in town

name: Ryan Keleher
reviews: Great coffee - really like the seating and open feel

name: Matthew Parker-Jones
reviews: Great additional Dineen location downtown and a go to place for coffee chats. I like the fact that they offer table service as well, which is a nice touch.

name: Ayman Fathalla
reviews: Good coffee and ambience

name: M Roy
reviews: I don't care for the bankers crowd but I just love the setting! A bit pricy, but the coffee is excellent. Staff are pros.

name: Xoan A
reviews: Who would've thought that a coffee pop-up would become a hot spot for business meetings and coffee chats. The coffee is great and the place is surprisingly comfortable.

name: Ray Brooks
reviews: Great for an informal business chat in an interesting, sun filled atrium.

name: John Spears
reviews: Amazing americanos!

name: Andrea Van Overbeek
reviews: Yuuuuuummmmy! A great cup of coffee and awesome atmosphere!

name: Laura Garzon
reviews: Amazing spot to talk and have a little drink or a coffee. They serve alcohol and serve tables. Amazing spot but sometimes lines are very long.

name: Justin Tiu
reviews: Dineen in the CIBC Commerce Court lobby is easily one of my favourite early morning coffee spots. To me, it feels like a small piece of Manhattan, before the morning rush begins. But unlike Manhattan, the barista's are always friendly and seldom even seem stressed out.

name: Denys Berestyuk
reviews: Best Cortado in the city!

name: Farah Rueck
reviews: Quick service...nice ambiance

name: David Emanuel
reviews: Best coffe in town!

name: Ron McKay
reviews: Great coffee and super friendly staff... Despite the massive crowds

name: Joe C
reviews: Love the cappuccino.  The light roasted beans are great for home too.

name: Carim ‚ÄúCas London‚Äù James
reviews: The cafe offers an open dining option for street level commerce court for daytime business and functions.

name: Kash Kannaiti
reviews:
This location has a great advantage of being inside the Commerce Court building with high ceilings, large lobby, glass all around yet a cozy setting area.
I like their menu selection and quality of products.

name: Cary Wang
reviews: Great service! Generally i go with the americano!

name: Karen Bartley
reviews: Sometimes regular coffee just isn't hot enough. However decor is amazing and ambience wonderful

name: Behrooz Kashani
reviews: Great coffee , but the hot chocolate is not hit

name: Rohitash Hurla
reviews: Cortados to die for

name: Jeff Good
reviews: Met my friend who was staying at the Adelaide Hotel here for drinks and to catch up. I was concerned it would be packed with the business crowd or not cool with us sitting and chatting, but the staff were awesome and very chill. The election of food isn't huge, and the drink menu is limited, but I felt right at home and would happily go back again.

name: Dave Deco
reviews:
Great coffee, pricing is fair.
Cool bar-style design.
Ideal for professionals to grab a coffee.
Line up quite long between 9-10am

name: Jay Nam
reviews: Good coffee and lots of seating for such a small place.  But can be slow service as it is usually very busy.

name: Steven Solarz
reviews: Good coffee, impossibly slow service

name: Ibraheem Aziz
reviews: Great service and a delicious variety of drinks!

name: CC LARA
reviews: Beautiful place but coffee isn‚Äôt extraordinary

name: Lev Glick
reviews: Good coffee to start the day

name: Jarylle Adriane
reviews: It was alright. I kinda felt I was treated rudely by one of the barista I asked for the liquid sugar. They pointed me on the condiments bar where they thought it was located but I told them it wasn‚Äôt there and ended up walking on the other side to grab it. But its ok

name: Brianna Dueck
reviews: Delicious coffee.

name: Dmitry Romanenko
reviews: Comfy coffee spot inside of business center with tables. I was satisfied with quality of coffee and amount of available minimalistic seating area, but was a bit disappointed that when my coffee was meant to be brought by staff upstairs, but wasn't after 15 minutes, and when I found out that it's waiting at pickup area I had to bring it upstairs myself. I suggest they should either bring themselves or tell customers exactly that they should take care of it.

name: Snow Zhou
reviews: The cappuccino was a WOW!!!

name: HyunJung Joung
reviews: One of the best latte I ever tried. Really enjoyed it!

name: Chris Weng
reviews: Thank you!

name: Scott Norris
reviews: Nice coffee, super friendly staff!

name: FreeTayK47 l
reviews: Thanks Chris

name: J P
reviews: My fav Montreal coffee finally made it to Toronto. Their beans are top notch with depth of flavour and profiles like few out there. I have been a subscription member for a number of years and have enjoyed everything I have recieved. A must try in my books.

name: Ramea Ashok
reviews: Thank you Scott!!

name: Yellow_Duck
reviews: coffee is good. Security gaurd on weekend is so handsome and kind.

name: Max Olivier
reviews: Thank you!

name: dikshant grover
reviews:
My new favourite place to work and have amazing Montreal coffee!
It‚Äôs serendipitous because I remember walking into a dispatch during my first trip of Montreal last January and the barista told me a Toronto one would open in the near future.
Part of me wants this place to stay a little hidden so that it doesn‚Äôt become 120% occupied most of the time like most Toronto cafes..

name: Justin -
reviews: Thank you JP!

name: Joseph Munro
reviews: Thank you, Ramea!

name: Daniel Ah Tou
reviews: Thank you for the review! We'd love to know what could bring us to five stars - we're always open for feedback at info@dispatchcoffee.ca :)

name: EUNJEONG LEE
reviews:
Hands down the best coffee shop in the city.
Everyone is super nice. It's a huge space nested in the financial district. Perfect spot to relax or do some work. The coffee is 11/10 and they rotate the beans everyday.

name: Ramya Gudipudi
reviews: Wow, thanks for the awesome review Max! See you soon!

name: Joshua Wiener
reviews: Thank you so much!

name: Tara Kachroo
reviews: Thanks so much, Justin!

name: Marine
reviews: I always go to dispatch every after gym, but today, the barista wasnt that approachable, didnt even ask me if I want it hot or cold and just put what I said and asked me to pay then made my drink. So he made me the iced one, but I didnt told him that I want it hot. I know its my fault for forgetting, but I think its better to clarify things first as well before making a drink. Been to many coffee shops around downtown but I always go back to dispatch because of the great coffee, but I guess not anymore. Service is one of the most important aspects to attain customers. üòä

name: Raquel Rodrigues
reviews: Hi Arianne! We're so sorry to hear that your experience this day was disappointing. Feedback is always helpful and I've passed yours on to the team. We're always striving to provide the best service possible and hope that that's what you will receive should you decide to come back again. You're right - great coffee is not the only thing that matters!

name: Tianran WANG
reviews: The best coffee I've ever had in Toronto. My latte had perfectly steamed milk, and the staff was very friendly.

name: Darren Mak
reviews: Wow, thank you so much Joseph! That's so great to hear. Hope to see you soon!

name: R M
reviews: Free coffee with purchase of beans is legit strategy!

name: Theresa
reviews:
Thank you G G! We're glad you think so, it's just a small thank-you for the support! 
Would love to know what could bring us to 5 stars out of 5 - we're always open to feedback at info@dispatchcoffee.ca :)

name: Maggie Z
reviews: Thanks so much for the 5 stars, Daniel!

name: Daniel Arsenault
reviews:
(Translated by Google) 2022. 11. 03 visit
It is a coffee shop where you can sit quietly and enjoy coffee in downtown Toronto.
There are about 8 tables on the 2nd floor, so you can sit and drink coffee. The customers are quiet, and there is quiet music in the cafe, so it seems to be a good space to come and read a book or study. The staff taking the order was also very kind, so I remember going there after drinking a pleasant coffee.

name: More Spinach
reviews: Thank you for the wonderful review, we're so glad we made a good impression!

name: Ally MYC
reviews: Stumbled upon this new place, got latte and scones so good! Definitely recommended!

name: John Mendoza
reviews: Hi Ramya - so glad you enjoyed your visit! See you soon :)

name: Jani
reviews: Best coffee in downtown Toronto

name: Noah Ifergan
reviews:
Thank you so much Jina! 
- Chrissy

name: Laura Ma
reviews: Hi Joshua, thanks for the review! We'd love to hear more critical feedback if you ever have the time as to what would inspire a 5 star vs. 4 star review :) - info@dispatchcoffee.ca

name: Ben V
reviews: Went there to check out the coffee. Coffee shop is cute, seating is on second level with tables and couches. Has 11 types of ground available for purchase. I tried the Guatemala espresso ground today, on the bitter end with citrus/nectarine notes. Strong espresso. Has pastries and cookie treats. Cortado was $4.90 total. Good spot to check out downtown. Unsure if it would be my go to spot.

name: Sean Leung
reviews:
Hi MT, thanks for this feedback, please email us if you do have the time at info@dispatchcoffee.ca for more direct feedback as to what would make us your go - to! We'd love to hear. 

- Chrissy

name: Jun Park
reviews: Corporate space - very clean and spacious, lots of natural light, very fast service, but regularly a line up in the morning right before 9am.

name: Farnoosh Brock
reviews:
Hi Tara, thanks for this review and feedback! We are experiencing busier days for sure and looking to ensure we can deliver the speediest service possible to shorten that line up. We hope to see you again soon :)

- Chrissy

name: Tenzo
reviews: Bright and uplifting cafe attached to the building. Access on Richmond street. Excellent match latte! Comfortable sitting and free wifi.

name: Trent Marbach
reviews: Hi Marine, thanks so much for this nice review :) Glad you enjoyed the Macha latte :)

name: Zoltan Debre
reviews: Amazing coffee and the baristas are so kind!

name: Justin Weisz
reviews: Thanks for this feedback! We will pass on the word to our team :)

name: E Y
reviews: Been on their beans since they opened this branch, stable great quality

name: Yuxi Chen
reviews: Hi Tianran! Thanks so much for your support and the review :) See you soon

name: Scott Cooper
reviews: Amazing cafe! The barista, Karen, was so attentive to all my needs and I definitely will be back for my weekly latte fixüòÅ ‚Ä¶

name: Ryan Cheung
reviews: Hi Darren - thank you for this lovely feedback!

name: SaraLi Forouzanfar
reviews: Great location for coffee with good seating and ports to get work done. Lots of seating with high chairs and great wifi

name: Marium Amin
reviews: Thank you R M :) Glad you enjoyed your visit!

name: Elyjah Schimmens
reviews: Clean, minimalist space in the Financial District serving good coffee. Easy in, easy out.

name: Christian Mathews-Gagne
reviews: Thanks for the great review, Theresa!

name: Adrian B
reviews: Lovely cafe with friendly baristas and delicious coffee, would love to visit again!

name: karen d.
reviews: Then we'll see you soon Maggie! :)

name: Luciano Rizzi
reviews: High quality coffee and a really quiet comfortable space to enjoy the coffee and some company.

name: Qinyan Zhao
reviews: Thank you Daniel!

name: Benny Tong
reviews: No way is this a 4.7 in terms of actual coffee. Beautiful shop and great location. But coffee bean is now fruity mild Canadian rubbish, and baristas are often undertrained and overworked so they make a quick and dirty silly coffee I can make at home. Nor what this used to be. Still a decent rendezvous for meetings, but an ordinary coffee shop for actual coffee.

name: Alexandra Marquez
reviews:
Hi there More Spinach - we're disappointed to hear you didn't enjoy your visit at our Toronto location. We'd like to hear more about the coffee you were served. You can reach us at info@dispatchcoffee.ca.

We are a third wave coffee roaster, thus our beans are roasted medium-light and are very different from say traditional Italian espresso caf√©s! We encourage you to read more about the coffee farmers we support here: www.dispatchcoffee.ca/pages/impact. Our baristas are well trained and experienced in the industry, but we understand if you didn't like the drink you ordered! Hoping to hear from you via email.

name: Gabriel Lessard
reviews: Really good flat white. But what I loved the most was the upstairs seating area. Great ambience.

name: Adam Gilani
reviews: Thank you Ally - see you soon :)

name: Erinna Sanders
reviews:
I do appreciate places like these. Designed for remote work and meetups. Right in financial district. Has a mezannine up top with an abundance of comfy seating. I can't give it a full 5 though. It's too... perfect. (Also wi-fi was meh.)

name: Bob Taylor
reviews: Nice spot on Queen a little tired and coffee was a step up from Tim's

name: Martin Ayliffe Smith
reviews: Excellent quality fare prepared with care by friendly and competent staff.

name: Courtney Ayukawa
reviews:
Vibe and atmosphere is cute and cozy with a good amount of seating upstairs.

I think they recently increased their prices and the menu on their website might be out of date.
I don't feel like what I got was worth it. After tax and 15% tip, my club sandwich and side minestrone soup was $26. Inflation hitting hard!

Very few options for people who are lactose intolerant or vegan as nearly all menu items have cheese.

name: paul booi
reviews: One of the best places in the beach

name: Rhiannon B
reviews: They don‚Äôt pay their employees if they don‚Äôt have to, apparently (I opened a labour board dispute and won and they STILL didn‚Äôt pay me, a former employee came in when I was working there and said they did her dirty as well as another review here has another employee saying the same)‚Ä¶they also bought pastries from a local cafe/pie place (now closed) and repeatedly froze & thawed them out to sell at full price as a daily business practice - one of many cut corners. I wouldn‚Äôt eat any of the food. If you‚Äôre disabled, green or naive definitely keep on looking for a job, it‚Äôs not worth it - this couple will be mean to you and/or take advantage.

name: Maliha K.
reviews: Not too bad, if I‚Äôm being honest not my FAVOURITE coffee shop on the beaches because I feel like the coffee is sometimes not fresh and the matcha drinks are 98% milk and 2% matcha. I do however love the service and their baked stuff, brownies and cookies are great here!! If you‚Äôre looking to get their salads though I would probably not.. there‚Äôs better salad other places around. Great customer service though, super friendly people, just not too good for their actual drinks :( Not worth the price, sorry!!

name: Jim W
reviews: It's fine. Been here twice and the food is not worth the price but it was fine. The crepe menu looks good but the sandwich board is approaching fine dining prices for basic sandwiches. It seems to be busy with an older local clientele. The way their stock is stored is quite odd. It was very clean but cluttered in layout.

name: Eri Maeda
reviews: The prices on the menu are increase and no longer matching on their website but still the best crapes on the Beach!

name: Fiona e
reviews: Horrible woman. I was told to ‚Äúnot move around and sit down‚Äù after I went upstairs to look around and connect to the wifi. Also their bagels are half the size of regular bagels and they are charging 5$ more then the bagel place in my neighbourhood Yonge and Eglinton.

name: Kara Beharry
reviews: Really enjoyed my experience at this Cafe. The name is misleading as they offer lots of food items. Oh well, after a 30km bike ride my appetite was definitely satiated with one of their savory crepe, hot sandwich, and delicious chai tea latte. Huge shout-out for making that great cup of chai. It was yum-o! Will definitely come back.

name: Gwyn Susan
reviews: Great place. Friendly staff. Good coffee. Left my phone behind by mistake but the gentleman had it behind the counter when I arrived to check for it.

name: Iryna Marchuk
reviews:
VERY Disappointed!!
We came to the place right before they were closing and ordered 1 cup of americano and 1 cappuccino, paid $10 for the order and americano was beyond disgusting! They were rushing to close at 4:40 and felt like they didn‚Äôt change the coffee from the previous client and made this ‚Äúbrown water‚Äù for my order. I couldn‚Äôt drink this absolutely gross ‚Äúdrink‚Äù and had to just poor it out! üëéüèª

name: Dean Singh
reviews: Great coffee

name: scott ewen
reviews: Great local favourite for lunch , breakfast,  coffee , all home made cooking. Delicious pastries, you can‚Äôt go wrong here . Wonderful staff.

name: John Brune
reviews: We ate three different wrap's, they were very good and also good price. We ate upstairs very comfortable and clean. Everyone working were very pleasant. We came up from Alabama, if we get a chance to visit again we will most likely eat there.

name: Sanjoli Jain
reviews:
Cute cafe with sunny patio at the beaches!

Stop by for a coffee, quick snack or full meal. I tried their blueberry muffin which was WOW, so good! ‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Dr. Adam Bletsoe
reviews: Yum!!!  Such tasty food.  I had The Breakfast Sandwich on a ciabatta bun.  Cait had a smoothie packed with fruit!

name: Suzie Santos
reviews: Love the ambiance service and everything else about this place. The owner always greets you with a smile on her face, a place to feel welcome.

name: ruhl mcgill
reviews: Terrible.

name: EV Palisoc
reviews:
This is now our neighbourhood Go-To place to relax and enjoy a cup of coffee or tea, and their savoury crepes and salads.
Helen and her staff are really warm and friendly, and their shoppe is so inviting and comfortable.
We especially enjoy lounging upstairs by the fireplace with a hot chocolate...

name: Olivia Morgan
reviews: Staff is not friendly & coffee is overrated. I dropped my coffee in the store after I paid $7.00 for a coffee and I tipped. They made me buy another one. Plus they force people to tip when just ordering coffee at the cash. Never going back again

name: Arash A
reviews: Nice coffee and menu in general, very friendly staff . Highly recommanded

name: Austin McAuley
reviews: Love the coffee. Worth a stop.

name: Anna Trouchina
reviews: Came here a few times and absolutely love their food and service. First time, we ordered the stuffed peppers with meat to take home - and oh my gosh so yummy and full of flavor. Second time, ordered the Cubano sandwich and the smoked salmon crepe. The Cubano is perfect, very yummy and the crepe is well balanced with smoked salmon, cream cheese, onion and capers. Definitely will be back to try other items. They‚Äôre also very nice people. Thank you so much!

name: Jena Ravindran MEI
reviews: The lady that worked there was very rude and I ordered a quesadilla with no veggies (just salsa and sour cream on the side, as stated on the menu) and when I got my order 15 minutes later there was no salsa and the sour cream was taziki. I told her that there was no salsa so she whipped up some ‚Äúsalsa‚Äùthat was very gross. 10/10 do not recommend

name: Bruce Fullerton
reviews: Absolutely delicious authentic feeling and great service family favourite

name: Ailsa Ferguson
reviews: It's not busy just now but it's got great food! Just bought the chicken parm -- really delicious! Two dinners if I don't pig out. ..

name: Dimetre Alexiou
reviews: Awesome staff, and great food.

name: Douglas Lapointe
reviews: Owner of this placed was very rude to customers and employees.

name: Angela
reviews: Bad service - pressured to tip. Average food and drink

name: Aqib Sakhia
reviews: The crepes are great and the staff is friendly

name: Anna Moskovchenko
reviews: Friendly staff, amazing coffee and wonderful atmosphere. Super happy that they had indoor seating and maintained such great social distancing!

name: Robert Lee
reviews: Cute patio in the Eastern Beach.

name: Melanie Sands
reviews: Good food, worth the wait while the make it!

name: Sergey Talashkevich
reviews: Amazing sandwiches!

name: Riz F
reviews: The best brownies I have ever tried and they also make very good date squares. üòÉ ‚Ä¶

name: H Nouraei
reviews: Nice coffeehouse

name: Fabian Baijnauth
reviews: Great local Cafe with amazing baked goods and coffee

name: BAEWOON LEE
reviews:
(Translated by Google) The staff are friendly, the coffee tastes good, and the inside is cozy, but surprisingly there are plenty of seats. This is a very nice cafe

name: Linda Fair
reviews: Love the crepes!

name: Vivienne McCuaig
reviews: The location is great and the food and coffee is fine; however, the service is atrocious. The owner can be quite surly and employees come and go on what seems to be a weekly basis. Be prepared for long line ups.

name: Niko Kuparinen
reviews: Clean cafe with good service, and friendly staff. A selection of good coffees (especially the hazelnut vanilla), and good, fresh-made food (sandwiches, salads, crepes). The daily soups are good, but get it while you can; they sell out fast.

name: KelticRogue
reviews: menu (sweet or savory crepes, sandwiches, soups, stews and chilli available), hot beverages and cold drinks, also baked goods

name: Devyn Hill
reviews: Great bread and fresh sandwiches. Lots of veg options !

name: Sumeeth S.
reviews:
The Beaches has plenty of cafes to choose from, and I would definitely avoid this place.

Food is mediocre and coffee is average. Most importantly, the service is horrible! I live in the area and would occasionally frequent this cafe. I would always be greeted with a stern frown for a greeting.

There are better options in this area, and better choices  when it comes to food, drink, and service.

name: Aya Hachicho
reviews:
This place is actually really great in the winter! It‚Äôs very cozy. Their mocha was good.

I also ordered a vege delight crepe, it was ok but I wish it had more flavor. The sauce was on the side and would have preferred it on the inside to add some taste to the veges

name: Jesse Isakow
reviews: Always delicious and fresh

name: Dianna English
reviews: Really lovely staff. Chicken Caesar wrap is so yummy. But my favorite thing is that they have really really good fresh brewed iced tea. Makes my American heart so happy! Flavors are light, and tea tastes fantastic.

name: Angela Arnold
reviews: Overpriced! Same food you can make at home with pancake batter ,and would probably be better &warmer! And cheaper by far ! Get over your selves juice & java cafe it's pancake batter not gold dust!!! Major league FAIL

name: Trina Szkut
reviews: There areonly a few breakfast place to try on this side of Queens street. We woke up late from a trip and it was pass 11 AM  finding a breakfast place to eat. We want to enjoy the place where we could feel we were in The Beaches area and would not like to eat in a fast food joint and found  Juice & Java. Big seating area in/out,The food was good for breakfast,service is average, self service except for  food was delivered to our table. Pricing I think is somewhat high for the food and service offered.

name: Nicole N
reviews: Quality food for a reasonable price in a cute spot, great for coffee catch-ups with friends or even small business meetings. Heard the crepes were amazing, so we shared the Greek and salmon crepes - both were delicious! Their fresh lemonade is good too!

name: Christopher Ball
reviews: Very good crepes and sandwiches

name: Travis Hay
reviews: I love it here. The service is friendly, the atmosphere is so casual, and the food is DELICIOUS! Such a great secret of the beaches!

name: LightHouse Verner
reviews: Always fresh ingredients

name: Van Nguyen
reviews:
Long wait time and not as described.

I ordered a loose leaf iced tea asking for it to be unsweetened and they claimed their drinks didn‚Äôt have added sweeteners... which it did.

The drink itself tasted fine and I don‚Äôt like to post negative reviews for independent owned shops... but the Nutella crepe was disgustingly sweet and the strawberries were not fresh. I thought it would be fresh considering it was a $10 crepe - but I can tell when it‚Äôs defrosted frozen strawberries. Because of the strawberries, I had to write a review to let others manage their expectations.

Also if management is reading this, you need to go easy on the Nutella.

name: Angus Palmer
reviews: Go here pretty regularly on weekend.  Their Specialty Breakfast is tasty and good value. Service is pleasant. Nice quiet atmosphere.  You can actually hold a conversation if you wish, without the music overwhelming you.

name: Simon Batcup
reviews: The cappucino and americano's that we ordered were ok. The pastry was OK, but we felt overpriced for the quality. Had to reorganise the chairs on the small outside patio. The service was friendly.

name: Teresa Yeung
reviews: Little cafe with breakfast and lunch options in the beaches. I got the chicken bacon and aioli sandwich which i really liked. My friend got a caesar wrap which was mehh. They so have fresh lemonade! Sandwiches are around $8-$10.

name: Jose Elson Pereira Amaral (Elson amaral)
reviews:
(Translated by Google) Great place to have a very good coffee and snacks

(Original)
√ìtimo local para tomar um cafe e lanches muito bom

name: Jimmy Zhou
reviews: Great atmosphere and staff

name: Craig Bernhard
reviews: Independent business is amazing.   I applaud this place for competing and winning in this area.   Bravo!  Great food and fresh coffee.  Love the space

name: Purdy Fine Finish Professional Painting
reviews: Great coffee

name: Lorraine Syratt
reviews: Two stars for effort.  Gave us the wrong order first. No apologies. But the worst thing was the worst grilled cheese any in my party had ever had ... tasted like cardboard. And then there's that smiley face created with ketchup. It's not charming, Juice & Java. It's silly. And given the price you charged for it, a pickle or a bit of coleslaw on the side would have made up for the bland cheese. I wish I knew what cheese that was, so I'll remember never to buy it..  And to top it off,  you served it in a cereal bowl. Really?

name: Nicolas Basilewsky
reviews: One of the best coffees at the Beaches - nice staff

name: Silvana Tieko
reviews: Excelente service, place and delicious food and drink. I ate a ham and cheese sandwich (with tomatos and lettuce) and I drink coffee. I payed CAD$ 12.77 with taxes.

name: Cornel Petrar-Silca
reviews: Very friendly staff, good products.

name: Lawrence Lee
reviews: Cozy little shop!  Great pastry and coffee.

name: janita castillo
reviews: This place does have good food and drink. But I find it over priced. My main complaint is that they constantly forget about peoples orders . Even when they aren't busy.

name: autumn g
reviews: The sandwiches and coffee are great here!

name: Ronak Dhanak
reviews: The coffee here tastes different than most of the other coffee shops.. probably the beans that they use. I found the coffee stronger yet subtle and more earthy. Along with the  coffee we had the vegetable sandwich (rye bread) and the carrot muffin. The sandwich was extremely fresh and the bread was good..but what needs to be commended is the carrot muffin- absolutely delicious. The place is spacious with a wonderful team and even has a little library of its own. An excellent  choice to sit back and let the weariness dissolve!

name: M Ddz
reviews: Delicious food and cafe!! The armosphere is also perfect, you can work, have a quick snack, catch up. The staff are supper nice and accomodating as well. My favourite is the curry tuna melt, breakfast crepe, salmon toast.!

name: Nick Panayotakos
reviews: Nice, cozy cafe with quality drinks and food. Definitely recommended.

name: john manson
reviews: Excellent coffee , good sandwiches , tasty muffins , definitely high priced. What they sell there breakfast sandwich,coffee and a muffin for , Tim Hortons are excalty half price . Identical items.

name: April Kay
reviews: Best coffee & crepes on Queen & offering original art from local artists year round.

name: Patrick Judge
reviews: Have been a patron hear for a long time off and on. Owners are warm and friendly. Menu is brunch crepes, sandwiches and baked goods. Great coffees and teas with a very warm and relaxed atmosphere suitable for all ages

name: T Kurosawatsu
reviews:
Cosy atmosphere and heart warming service. With excellent coffee and food.
Love this place.

name: Daniel
reviews: Great cafe and staff, however, poor choice of music. Would be a 5star if they played background music (lower volume) and some light jazz or classical. Something to soothe the mind and create a beautiful setting, rather than radio and corporate music. Or just bad pop. Too much noise. Please create a mood and ambience.

name: Marc K
reviews: Good coffee

name: Jazzy B.
reviews:
(Translated by Google) We went there twice in the summer to buy coffee and pastries. The food and drinks have always been high quality, tasty and well made. I found the wait to be a bit long, and there was only one waitress. In addition, the shop is quite expensive, hence a star deduction. Otherwise great.

(Original)
Wir waren im Sommer 2x dort um Kaffee und Geb√§ck zu kaufen. Die Speisen und Getr√§nke waren jedes Mal hochwertig, lecker und gut gemacht. Die Wartezeit empfand ich als etwas lang, es war auch nur eine Bedienung da. Au√üerdem ist der Laden recht teuer, daher ein Stern Abzug. Sonst super.

name: Gina Ellison
reviews: Came in for a quick snack while shopping locally. Ended up staying for a bit to enjoy the A/C and my purchases. You know how you can get a blueberry muffin and there's like 4 berries in it? Yeah, not here! Muffin was huge and had a very satisfying berry to cake ratio. They were also plump and juicy. I also had an iced hazelnut vanilla coffee. They offer their coffees and teas as hot or iced for same price. Looking at their extensive menu on the wall, they also serve crepes, omelets, sandwiches, and some other standard baked goods which are all baked from scratch in store.

name: Samin Bidhendi
reviews: one of the most unwelcoming and ill-mannered cafes I have ever been to... I asked for a sandwich (which is supposedly their specialty), the answer was "you can't have it, I have the stuff but it takes too long, I can't make it for you"!!!!  ... they can't fulfill the very basics of their job description!

name: Canadian Bacon Sarnie
reviews: Waited almost 15 minutes for a toasted bagel to go,  it was microwaved and soggy.  I wish there was another place to go around this area.  They seem to get by because there's no competition.   They could also use some cheering up in there, the staff is not very friendly.  Their coffee is weak and never hot enough.  Every time I go there, I'm disappointed.

name: Charlotte Stern
reviews: Good food. smoothies. seating and great customer service. I will be back

name: Dhiman Mitra
reviews: A unique  coffee place. Real cups to  drink  from, good quality  coffee. Wooden tables give that homely feeling. Go sit in the upstairs loft for a quiet time away from the main floor. Nice baked goods  also to go  with your  coffee.

name: Marta chmielnicka
reviews: Great food

name: Jose Jimenez
reviews: Crepes are great

name: Jenna Robar
reviews: Wi-Fi is off and on.. but good vibe, good baked goods, and friendly staff! Gets busy from 1-4ish

name: Bruce Sharland
reviews: Excellent hot chocolate ... Very warm and inviting on a very cold dsy...

name: Christian Chiari Manni
reviews: The place is located in the heart of the Beaches. It's spacious and well organized. I had a cup of coffee and a sandwich. Good quality and good value. You won't be disappointed. Internet wasn't working, can't tell you if it was a random thing. The heat was definitely not working well. The place had some space heaters but it was quite cold. Again, I'm not sure if it was a random thing or just the norm. It was quite uncomfortable, and since the number of space heaters I suspect it was not so random. There was ice on the inside of the window. Perhaps I was just out of luck.

name: Scott Taber
reviews: Great food and bevvies

name: Peter Malachi Feeney
reviews: Great euro style cafe

name: :M :DeRufaie
reviews: The prices is higher than tim Horton. But higher quality.

name: Steve Burnside
reviews: Great food and super coffee .. I'll be back again

name: pianomanbrad
reviews: I stopped in for a quick lunch and had the grilled chicken, brie, and pear sandwich with a bowl of chili.  It was amazing, and I relaxed and used the wifi upstairs.  Highly recommend!

name: Pierre Gautreau
reviews: Beautiful place to study

name: Gerhard Gehrmann
reviews: Lovely coffee shop. Great atmosphere.

name: j l

Love the London fog drink I highly recommend it. The smoothies are made with real fruits and no sugar added which is good. Their crepes are really well done topped with your choice of toppings. The Italian wedding soup is great. So overall I don't have anything bad to say.

name: Colette Vallieres
reviews: Matcha latte time!

name: Anthony
reviews: Good food, quite place.

reviews: great service, eclectic space with lots of seating and delicious peanut butter cookies!

name: Florian Denizot
reviews: Cozy place with great cr√™pes.

reviews: Food is good. Seating area is great. The only problem with this place is it's so dirty.

reviews: Friendly people, cool vibe. Great coffee, and a good environment to hang with a friend or get some work done. The on side library means you're never bored. Most of the place plus bathrooms is up a few stairs.

reviews: Nice place to hang out and have a cup of coffee. Great patio when weather is warm and sunny.

reviews: Apple and Brie crepe was a little dry.  Staff are really friendly

name: Monica Holboke
reviews:
Terrible food and service - don't bother.

name: Dario E.
reviews: Wanted to like this place because of the atmosphere (it's cozy which is the only plus), however, on several occasions that I have come here they have been out of basic ingredients - juices, breads, milks. The staff are also very forgetful -had to remind them a few times of my order and that I was waiting. Today I ordered my first "meal". 9$ (plus tip). For the sandwich, they used the last bottom pieces of the bread (you know the tiny pieces at the front and end of a loaf of bread?) and gave me 4 pieces saying they were mini sandwiches. Not to mention they were over toasted/slightly burnt to the point where biting down to them cut my gums. I literally could have made this sandwich at home for less than I paid. It's really a shame because the atmosphere is nice but that does not excuse them from delivering good food. it just is not somewhere I would ever recommend a friend to go to if they wanted a decent sandwich... or smoothie apparently (refer to the other 1 star review).

name: Kirsten Visima
reviews: Worst smoothie ever! I asked for a Berry Mango smoothie with almond milk and I got a very weak tasting drink with barely any fruit and extremely pail in colour.  I had trouble believing any berries were even used because the drink was so pale. Last time I checked strawberries were RED and mangos are ORANGE so why was my smoothie almost colourless??? I quickly came back with my smoothie to complain, and  the response I got from the guy behind the counter was so disappointing. He shrugged his shoulders and said "sorry". Claimed he put berries in it and that was the end of the conversation. Didn't do anything to rectify the situation. For the hefty price that it cost, (PLUS TIP!!!) I was expecting a whole lot better of a response. Hell, a scoop of berries would have been enough. Worst customer service ever. Will never go back.

name: Eric FREMONT
reviews:
(Translated by Google) A practical and quiet place to eat pancakes or a sandwich. The reception is correct and there is a good value for money.

(Original)
Un endroit pratique et calme pour manger des galettes ou un sandwich. L'accueil est correct et il y a un bon rapport qualit√© prix.

name: Murray ElHam
reviews: Service is slow, but the little patio space is nice and the upstairs seating area is great for a quiet weekend afternoon with a book.  The crepes are freakin GOOD!  While everywhere else has a lineup at brunch time, take your s.o. here and enjoy.

CRAIG MCCALLUM IS A THIEF, A LIAR AND LACKS COMPLETE INTEGRITY. HE WILL LIE TO ANYONE'S FACE TO PROTECT HIS BEHIND. HE IS ALL TALK AND WHEN IT COMES TO FACING THE MUSIC, HE RUNS AWAY LIKE A LITTLE COCKROACH. I DON'T KNOW HOW HE LIVES WITH HIMSELF EVERY DAY. SAVE YOURSELF THE STRESS AND BAD VIBES AND STAY AWAY FROM THAT PLACE AND STAY AWAY FROM THAT MAN.

name: Vickie Fu
reviews: Lots of really good drinks and cookies here! I always get the tiramisu latte üíõ ‚Ä¶

name: Anne

name: Anusree Roy
reviews: Mos Mos has the most incredible matcha in all of Toronto. It‚Äôs perfection! And their service is excellent as well.

reviews: Hi Anusree - we're glad you enjoyed your visit and the matcha latte! Hope to see you again soon :)

name: Maria Mejia
reviews:
Heard a lot of people recommended the coffee from this cafe and I FINALLY made my visit! üòúMos Mos Coffee is located in Downtown Toronto and they serve a variety of coffee and pastriesüíï (lots of cute donuts, all calling out to me!) This time, I got‚Ä¶.

‚òïÔ∏èCandamom Chai Latt√© ‚òïÔ∏è
I actually have not tried this latte, I was looking for something that has no sugar and the waiter recommended this to me! ü•∞It is one of my favourite now, I will definitely come back and get it again! ü§≠The Chai flavour is not as heavy as I thought it would be and every sip I drank was very soothing. üòãIf you are looking for something with no sugar but more on the milky side, this is definitely something you should try out! ü§†

üçã Lemon Poppyseed Loaf üçã
This was calling out to me, I am totally a fan of lemon poppyseed loaf. üòãTheir loaf was very yummy and rich in lemon flavour! It is more on the sweeter side and I wish there were more lemon flavour but totally loved it! ü§†

Other than Lattes, they also serve different coffees like flat white, Americano. üíïI have heard that their Matcha latte is very very good but they cannot do no sugar so I did not get to try this time! üëÄWill definitely come back for the Candamom Chai Latte!üòå

Thank you for yummy treats! ü§ç

name: Saiema Zia
reviews: Hi Vanessa - thank you for visiting and we're glad you enjoyed everything! We have a Ceremonial Matcha that has no sugar and we're able to make the Masala and Ginger Chai unsweetened as well. Come back in the spring/summer for our Lemon Blueberry Loaf if you like lemon! :)

name: aimee l
reviews: I came to the coffee shop since I had a couple hours to spare and wanted to study and do some work. Their wifi has a bunch of sites blocked which meant I only had access to my email. All of my google docs were not accessible and my online drive for school was also not accessible. For the price of the coffee I would at least expect some basic wifi connection. When I spoke with the manager all she said was that she could not help and that its not their wifi thats the problem, that its probably the site or my computer. Which is not true due to me being able to access my work and school from my phone using my data and later being able to access it with no issues at another coffee shop. Clearly they don't care about customer experience.

name: Samantha Woody
reviews: Hi Maria, we apologize we were not able to assist. This is the first time a customer has had issues with accessing a website so we have addressed this issue with IT to have them look into it. Hope to see you again soon.

name: Steff M. Domingos
reviews: Fast and efficient service. Great lattes and love the taro cookies!

name: A Zia

name: Dr. Pepper1975

I would have given them 5 stars but, the female behind the counter was not in a good mood...you're in the customer service business try to act like you like your job or at least be nice. When asked where the vegan donuts are don't just point, use your vocal chords. Anyways, the coffee was great; flavourful,  smoky and full of nutty and caramel notes and perfectly bitter. The "Bloomers" vegan donuts are amazing! Fluffy but dense and delicious.  I had the maple donut and it was fantabulous! I'd be back for the product but not the service.

reviews: There‚Äôs always something amiss with this particular Mos Mos shop. Either they tell me Espresso bean only have blonde roast (when they actually have medium roast) or this time, packed me a dark roast coffee bean instead of an espresso bean! Because the packaging was updated, I even asked the staff to checked if the coffee bean was for espresso and the staff told me it was. Please train your staff better on product knowledge so your customer does not have to make multiple trips back for return/exchange!

reviews: I had some trouble hearing the cashier so they spoke louder of course, but the overall interaction and attitude just felt very dismissive after that. I just think I visited on an off day for them. I love their drink selection and the variety of options for coffee and tea. The cookies are really delicious and fresh! I also loved how fluffy and big the vegan donut was. Although, I may have gotten the wrong flavour; I let them choose for me, and the one I received had a very tart, strong, sweet, fruitiness to it that just wouldn't sit right with me as I personally enjoy more mellow flavours. I also ordered the mango Chai latte with soy milk. That also didn't really work with me for similar reasons... but I will make another visit very soon and make some safer choices and adjust my review accordingly if the experience improves!

name: Amy Truong
reviews:
Easily some of the best chai lattes I've ever had! Lots of cafes with mediocre chai lattes go overboard with the cinnamon or the milk, but the ones here taste very balanced.

I had the cardamom and mango ones and they were both very delicious, with the rich taste of chai permeating the whole drink. I like how there's a complex aftertaste - you can taste the milk, the chai and your flavour of choice.

Note that the sugar level and toppings are adjustable, which is great for a little bit of customization. I personally found half sugar the right amount of sugar.

Also: my pickup order was packed with care and the staff was very friendly. 90% of cafes here don't give me a tray or paper bag unless I ask, but I got both without any prompting. Great service!

reviews:
NEO is a really nice coffee shop to relax.
It has a wide space, and the staffs are always friendly.
I ordered the seasonal Kurogoma Hojicha Latte and it was delicious.
The only downside of this place is their wifi limitation to 1 hour.

name: Khkllvc R
reviews: I had a wonderful experience at this cafe.The coffee and baked goods are delicious, and the atmosphere and seating areas are great. This is the perfect place to meet up with friends. For students in the area, the location is very good and the service is fast and friendly.

name: Andrea Li Calzi
reviews: Been coming here for years, my only spot for matcha latte

name: Athena Campbell
reviews:
I've been to this location  many times the last 3 years. I have to say the quality of food and drinks has gotten better. It is a Japanese style cafe. They offer matcha lattes, roll cakes, cheesecakes, pastries, and lunch options. I usually stop by for a quick drink and pastry.

During the pandemic, I felt that the espresso based drinks were watery and pastries were stale. But after 2 visits in the last 30 days, I can say that the quality has improved significantly. I had a decaf latte, and the espresso was full-bodied and aromatic. I ordered a croissant, and it was soft, buttery, and fresh. I observed that their pastries were made in-house because I saw two bakers actively working away. I'm glad they have worked on their products, and it is reflected in their quality.

My total for a latte and croissant came up to $10, which is going to be pricey for some, but it is the norm for downtown coffeeshops. They have narrow bench style seating along the cafe and a community table. It can become busy and crowded, and the entrance area can be packed. Making it difficult to find seating or figure out which line to stand in to place an order.

On the bonus side, they have a "Happy hour" of their own for house made drinks.  You get 50% off the same drink that you ordered earlier in the day. You just have to have your copy of the receipt as proof.

name: Flawnson Tong
reviews:
Really cute coffee store with a really nice ambiance. Their treats are so yummy and their coffee was one of the best in the city.

It‚Äôs a perfect place to come and study/work or to catch up with friends. The staff are extremely friendly as well.

name: Jarrett Smalley
reviews: Good matcha lattes (they use a good oat milk too) albeit pricey, 7.50 for a large. It comes naturally sweetened to the right amount for my taste. The store gets pretty busy during the days.

name: pedram karimi
reviews: An average coffee + pastry morning. I did drink the coffee and eat the croissant. I cannot not say much beyond this.

name: Scott Baker
reviews: Thanks Jarrett for the review! Please contact us at customercare@kinkafamily.com if you have any suggestions to help us improve the dining experience! Cheers!

name: Travel Culture Blog
reviews: Sometimes it's too busy, but a nice place to study and have coffee.

name: Caroline M
reviews: Incredible pastries. Coffee was perfect

name: Steven C
reviews:
Cute little spot with great latte.
I love that they have no computer policy for a couple of hours so you can actually enjoy other people company of a good book.
Cookies were amazing as well.

name: Francesca Norte
reviews:
Favourite coffee shop to be at. Interior is one of the best and most comfortable imo in the area. Coffee is great! Not the best ive ever had but id gladly come here daily.

Matcha is very strong with heavy umami, be warned if that isnt your cup of tea

Many hours spent here studying and working.

Staff is always friendly as well

name: Marta Melinda Pap
reviews: This coffee shop offers tasty speciality drinks and baked goodies. Their cookies and muffins are good. Customer service is good and fast. The inside of the store is pretty spacious and clean. They have tables and seats on the side walk. The location is good for university students and office works but not ideal for drivers. I would visit if I want to socialize and treat myself or a friend.

name: Alina Konstantinovna
reviews:
I give them 4 stars as the coffee and dessert I had were really good and the vibe was really nice. Definitely a good place to chat and catch up with friends over cafe drinks and Japanese inspired desserts. Service was also really nice and the washroom is kept clean.

They lose a star as they really don‚Äôt encourage any kind of laptop work which is evident in the way the space is designed as well as how their wifi works.

Majority of the tables are small and can only fit a laptop. They have one large table space if you need to use a mouse but that‚Äôs if there is space since larger groups typically take that space.

During the week they do allow laptop use (on weekends and statutory holidays laptops aren‚Äôt allowed) but they only allow you to connect to their wifi for 1hr. After an hour the wifi craps out and you won‚Äôt be able to renew your wifi time, at least that was my experience for both my laptop and mobile device.

If you‚Äôre looking for a space to work on your laptop for over an hour while having coffee/light bites during the week, this is not the place for you.

name: D. K.
reviews: Best ever Matcha latte in Toronto :) I cannot drink coffee for a while and this is absolutely the best alternative. I always take mine with oat milk. The design always brightens up my day. Thank you!

name: its_ asiancarlygirl
reviews: So good, coffee is very tasty and deserts are nice, good atmosphere

name: Joy Lee
reviews: Excellent hojicha and matcha. Japanese-approve!

name: Baowen Zhang
reviews: The seasonal hojicha latte taste so good, it has black sesame and hojicha in it, doesn‚Äôt include espresso but hojicha itself has little caffeine in it. The hot chocolate taste really nice in the winter. Latte art is so pretty as well! There‚Äôs also a coat hanger by the wall for customers, so for ppl who wants to take pictures, that‚Äôs perfect! Highly recommended!

name: Peanuts Butter
reviews:
Neo is a beautiful coffee bar with an unique array of selections; including Japanese inspired pastries, mochi and drinks. The space is beautifully lit with natural lights with large communal table by the window.

My colleagues and I adore their espressos and Hojicha latte. My favourite drink is Neo's authentic Hojicha powder from Kyoto with foamy oat milk.

Neo Coffee Bar is the perfect space to visit for an afternoon pick-me-upper.

reviews: Specialized in Japanese tea and latte. Dessert tastes good too. They have non laptop hours which promotes an environment where people just come here and connect with friends, not working

Still aromatic. quite a busy cafe but the japanese vibe of pastries are worth to try

reviews: Great ambience and nice coffee. Perfect place to hangout and grab some warm drink with friends, but if you wish to work longer hours on your laptop there are other cafe that don‚Äôt have 1 hour free wifi limit in store or laptop time during peak hours.

reviews: Liked this cafe. Their matcha was a bit more bitter that I‚Äôm used to, not sure if it‚Äôs because they make it at above 80 degrees.

reviews: Amazing pastries and smoked salmon sandwich! Great spot for relaxing afternoon tea.

name: George Tomou
reviews: Creative food and coffee vendors

name: Kate Connors
reviews:
RECOMMENDATION - Overall, if you want light snacks that don't overwhelm you and a place to chill, this will be right in your alley.

Food  - I got the Egg Salad Sando, Black Tea, and Basque Cheese Cake. Out of the three, the one I enjoyed the most was the Cheesecake. The other two fell flat for me. It was just standard, light snacks. Not memorable, but not bad.

Service - Great! Quick, professional and friendly. They were swamped and were working non-spot. You have lovely people working there.

Ambiance - Lots of seating to gather to talk to friends. I saw a bunch of people able to chill and chat. I love the atmosphere, and it boosted the place for me.

Accessibility: Getting in was a bit dicey, and the seating was very cramped. However, everything was on the first floor.

EDIT - Added an extra star for their reply and willingness to change. Most companies don't do that! :)
