name: Ana Maria Silva
reviews: Hi Kinjal! We thank you for taking the time to write to us. We wanted to let you know how sorry we are about this situation. It is our priority to provide excellent customer service, and we would like to learn more about what specifically happened. You can email us at customercare@kinkafamily.com, and we will do our best to rectify the situation. Thank you, and we hope to see you back at NEO COFFEE BAR soon!

name: Sena bozkƒ±r
reviews: Beautiful coffee place and very good

name: Roger Fournier
reviews: Love this place, great coffee the food is good (have had the muffin, roll cake, and cookie). Good vibe

name: Lior Asta
reviews: Not a huge fan of coffee or croissants also you can‚Äôt work here on the weekends.

name: R
reviews: Thanks Ariana for the review! Please contact us at customercare@kinkafamily.com if you have any additional suggestions to help us improve the dining experience! Cheers!

name: Veronica L
reviews:
(Translated by Google) Very rich coffee and I loved the place

(Original)
Muy rico el caf√© y el lugar me encant√≥

name: Saghar Azimi
reviews: Great ambiance & food

name: Hedia B
reviews: Cute coffee shop with various dessert options and delicious coffee!

name: Yurii Kosakivskiiy
reviews: The coffee drinks were okay but the pastries were amazing ü§© ‚Ä¶

name: Tanya Rabushka
reviews: The iced matcha latte had a strong matcha flavour and was lightly sweetened. One of the best I‚Äôve had. Will definitely return to try other drinks.

name: Lina Wu
reviews: I love the coffee here, tasted like heaven.

name: Andrew Woodrow-Butcher
reviews: This place is amazing! Their cookies are breakfastie stuff are to die for. Also amazing coffee! Will def go back.

name: Christiaan de Wit
reviews: Finally found tasty coffee in Toronto.

name: 6 Kat
reviews: I adore this coffee place. Best coffee downtown. I come for coffee every weekend and noticed recent changes. The barista has changed; coffee is still best, but the serving upsets. Sometimes I get less coffee in a cup, no heart drawings on the top (so fewer customers want to take a picture and post it, so less advertising for Neo), and already twice got colder coffee than it should be. I love this place; I just hope that some work will be done with the new barista and the previous level of coffee serving will be back.

name: Karina Kucherenko
reviews: Coffee isn't bad but I ordered on their own website and they didn't even realize they had orders until I mentioned it. They also only allow you to use their wifi for 1 hour. After the hour is up you have to wait 2 hours before you can retry. Disappointing because a lot of people like to do work at cafes...

name: Denis Kalogeropoulos
reviews: Hi Lina! Thank you for your review. Your comments have been shared with our upper management team as it is essential for us in improving our quality of service.

name: James Gleeson
reviews: Delicious drip coffee, nice space, friendly staff.

name: Taramissu Taramissu
reviews:
Best ever, delicious blueberry blackberry muffin with super big and crunchy top. All the baked good are amazingly  tasty. I like lattes and sandwiches as well.
Very friendly fast and immaculate  service!

name: Douglas Brewer
reviews: Very tasty coffee and turmeric.

name: Kris Jamal
reviews: Beautiful cafe in the heart of dt

name: Lloyd Luby
reviews: Great Coffee

name: Rodrigo Lobato
reviews: I really like their iced matcha latte I had at Japan Festival Canada 2022 so I decided to visit their store for the first time. Everything was fine when I ordered: ordered 2 iced matcha latte and one mochi to go. I didn‚Äôt know I need to get the lids myself so when the lady barista gave me the drinks without lids I just reminded her that‚Äôs for take away, and she looked very grumpy and rude just pointed and told me it‚Äôs over there. Speaking with the latte, I think the one I had at the festival was better, I think there‚Äôs not enough sugar and matcha taste can be stronger

name: Alexander Koons
reviews: Hi Taramissu! Thank you for your review. Your comments have been shared with our upper management team as it is essential for us in improving our quality of service.

name: Jose Rivera
reviews:
Japanese inspired decor and cakes, but missing the Japanese inspired service.

We ordered some of their vegan cookies and coffee.  The service was surprisingly slow, especially for just drip coffee.  Our coffees arrived sticky and covered in syrup/honey.  The barista was also annoyed when we asked for another cup to cover the residue.

Great place to sit down for a cake or to chill out, but the service is a bit lacking.

name: Steph Lauz
reviews: Hi Victor! Thank you so much for taking the time to write to us. We wanted to let you know how sorry we are about this situation. We make it a point to provide excellent customer service, and we would like to learn more about what specifically happened. You can email us at customercare@kinkafamily.com, and we will do our best to rectify the situation. Thank you.

name: Alexis Jieun Bae
reviews: Hi Lloyd, thanks for the review!

name: Jennifer He
reviews: Gooooooood place for everyone

name: Michael Johnson
reviews: Serious coffee makers.

name: Mika R
reviews: Great latte! Plenty of alternative milk options ‚Äî I got oat milk

name: Petro Rudenko
reviews: Great coffee. Simple menu. The roast is unique and gives it a toasty, unique flavor. The vibe inside is nice and all the employees and baristas were friendly. I do wish they had more vegan bakery items. Otherwise, great quick stop for coffee, and also a nice space to chill in if you need to sit and work or chat.

name: Moe Emami
reviews: Very good coffee

name: Samer Sultan
reviews: I saw this place online and saw they had pretty good reviews. However, when I went with my friend today I was really disappointed‚Ä¶ the prices are high for what you get, I assumed that since it‚Äôs more expensive then most places it would be better, I was VERY wrong. We watched the girl make our drinks and it‚Äôs straight up milk with a splash of matcha and hojicha. We ordered three items total and it came up to $30‚Ä¶ and the matcha tiramisu was not so good either and is served in a small dirty jar. Again you would think for that price it would be great, yeah save your money and go to Starbucks instead. I‚Äôm really sad and disappointed cause even the service wasn‚Äôt that great, the atmosphere is horrible if you plan on bringing a laptop cause there‚Äôs only two large tables available, the rest of the tables are the same size as a chair.

name: I Chen (AngelsofGod)
reviews:
Hi Steph! Thank you for your review. Your comments have been shared with our upper management team as it is essential for us in improving our quality of service.
We would like to do everything possible to improve the experience you have had at our location. Could you kindly email us at customercare@kinkafamily.com so that we can turn this into a positive experience?

name: Steph Parsons
reviews: Best latte I've had in a long time! I savoured it!

name: Ilya Kuznetsov
reviews: Outstanding service! I was extremely impressed by the effort the Attendant made to pour me an esthetically pleasing cappuccino. Service worthy of a tip!

name: Natalie Nasrallah
reviews: This was my first visit to place and my experience wasn't really great; I probably had too high expectation based on higher rating and good reviews. The place was pretty busy with limited/uncomfortable seats and only 1hr free access to wifi. And most of the drinks and food menu were quite pricey for the size and quality of the products. Overrated.

name: v a
reviews: Hi Alexis, we thank you for your feedback! A 1 hour fair-use limit does exist for customers to enjoy free Wifi at any of our locations.

name: Carolyn K-C
reviews: The barista called  me out when I was half way through my drink saying my card didn‚Äôt go through (although my Apple wallet showed a transaction and I showed it to her) and I ended up paying twice. Other than that, the matcha latte was okay.

name: Daniel Gomez
reviews: Hi Jennifer, Thanks for the review. Can you write to us at customercare@kinkafamily.com to let us know if we successfully refunded the second transaction? We would also like to know where we missed the mark with your Matcha Latte. Thanks!

name: Chynna Blue
reviews: Stopped in for a quick pick me up and was blown away by the decor and ambience! The staff were super friendly and my iced americano with blueberry muffin were so delicious and the perfect start to my morning! Highly recommend. :)

name: Valeria Mejia Cardona
reviews: delicious matcha cookies and tiramisu. iced hojitcha latte was great too. it was very full when i arrived but there was open seating outside. really nice cafe, can't wait to visit again.

name: Arnav Jindal
reviews: Awesome espresso. Great deserts. Cozy atmosphere.

name: Bilal Akil
reviews: Excellent coffee and very nice atmosphere

name: T.
reviews: I haven't been to the NEO coffee bar for quite sometime and wanted to see if it had changed. I purchase a hojicha matcha iced latte and half a strawberry rolled cake. The drink is something amazing as it had a host of bitter, sweet and the cool ice melding into a drink. The strawberry roll was delicious which had plenty of strawberries, freshly whipped cream clustered in the centre of the sponge roll. I would like to try their other drinks like the genmicha as it sounds interesting.

name: Liyun Xu
reviews: Lovely caf√© but disappointing, rather weak coffee (unless they were just having a bad day when I dropped in). However, the Sandos were excellent, flavoursome and substantial (highly recommend the egg salad and the smoked salmon).

name: Nethanel Pryor
reviews: Hi Steph! Thanks so much fort taking the time to write about your experience at NEO. We're sorry to hear we didn't quite hit the mark during your visit but do appreciate the kind words around our Sando offerings. They are great! Did you mention your concerns with the quality of your coffee with the Barista?

name: B G
reviews:
Their pastries and sandwiches are pretty nice. Peach Roll Cake was light, not too peachy, but fluffy indeed. Egg Sando was nice except for the fact that the contents will slob if taken out of their packaging (which they don't bother cutting in the middle).

Place is nice but can get loud when patrons speak loudly. No noise absorption, sound just bounces everywhere. Will still come back though but maybe sit outside.

name: Harsh Yadav
reviews: Amazing place. Best coffee in the city. Try their flat white.

name: Z Baghestani
reviews: Had a great Oatmilk flat-white from here! Pastries were good too. I got a gluten free matcha muffin with white chocolate chips and raspberry inside of it and it was delicious. My friends also loved what they got from here! One of my friends really loved her cold-brew that she got from here.

name: Kimchi Kim
reviews: Please update the working hours, as coffee is not being served after 6:50pm even to go.

name: chiransh gaur
reviews: The staff are genuinely nice and the sandwiches are fresh.  Best cappuccino I have had had in a very, very long time!

name: Selina Choi
reviews: Great coffee. Great food. Wish it was a bit cosier, but that's not really the vibe. Also, only one hour wifi and 'no-laptop' hours.

name: Isabella C
reviews: Awesome Japanese coffee place. I loved the Chai Tea Latte üçµüßã Miho is a very good barista! ‚Ä¶

name: S S
reviews: They have a ‚Äúpolicy‚Äù where you can only use your laptop for 40 minutes at a time and they time you from the moment you sit down. The employee wanted me to close my laptop for 10 minutes before I could use it again. I was using my own hotspot and the shop was not busy, plenty of empty table space. This rule makes no sense.

name: Alexander Kudin
reviews:
Best coffee shop in Toronto.
Impeccable quality. Very special selection of coffee variety.

name: Lexi
reviews:
Picked up an Americano and almond croissant here on my way to work. First impression is that the space is really pretty with modern Japanese cafe vibes. I went in wanting a croissant and when I first saw it in the display, I ignored my first thoughts that it looked kind of deflated and very small, especially for almost $5.

The coffee was pretty good. A pretty standard Americano and there's a station for your milk and sugar by the door.

The almond croissant might be the worst I've ever had. First up, it's a narrow shape and small, not wider than even a standard credit card (see pic for reference). Second, the texture was like a dense tortilla because there were no layers inside which I suspect is because the dough wasn't proofed and collapsed while baking (see pics for reference).  Third, the flavour was so off. It had no almond extract aroma or much flavour at all. Instead, because the croissant sits beside the rosemary cheddar croissant in the display, my croissant took on all the essence of sharp cheddar and rosemary and it was so off putting.

I've heard good things about their cakes but I don't recommend their croissants at all.

name: Smart Cupcake
reviews: When I went there in the Wednesday afternoon, the cookie choux, rolls are all sold out. Didn't know the pastries are limited. Very disappointed.

name: Noah S
reviews: 1st time in Toronto and love this place. Yummy coffee and bakery.

name: Aaron Wilson
reviews: Never going to order from here again. They called me after half an hour of accepting the order, only to cancel it. Unprofessional!!

name: Kevin Geng
reviews: Cute new cozy place in bay and college. It is a bit pricy for the size the tea, coffee and cakes. I liked the experience and the taste. No complaints. But it didn't have anything newer or standing out from other cafes around. So I most likely won't go again.

name: Michael Chang
reviews: I thought coffee shops are for people to grab a coffee, settle down and do work... until I found Neo Coffee Bar, which tries to get rid of their customers as quickly as possible from limiting wifi usage to 1 hr per day to enforcing a 'no-laptop' policy during peak hours. If you despise customers sticking around why open a coffee shop of all things?

name: Seoul Searcher
reviews: Chai latte was very good. I liked the ambience

name: Negar Shahrokh
reviews:
(Translated by Google) Hojicha Tea/Latte is delicious. It is recommended to go ice-free without sugar. The environment is more beautiful than Bloom Cafe, with more locations and an outdoor patio, but the cake puffs are worse than Bloom. Very noisy, not suitable for office and reading.

name: Sohyun Kim
reviews: Great quality of drinks & atmosphere!

name: Cl√©ment M
reviews: Sakura Cake was okay but a bit overpriced. Loved the flavour though!

reviews: If I would give less than one star I totally would. The place was cute but the coffee was super cold, and the cake did not even have any sugar or taste. I got sakura cake and there was no sweet in it, felt like I was eating a sponge. and the price for that was not even that fair. If you want to try cold coffee with non-tasty cake, you should go visit this place.

name: Johanna Zhang
reviews: I ordered a hot latte but unfortunately it was not very hot. By the time I sat down to drink my coffee it was almost cold. Their Sakura cake was also bland and tasteless. The place has a nice atmosphere but I won‚Äôt be coming back here anytime soon.

reviews: Enjoyed the vibe, coffee and cake was delicious too

name: Willy Leung
reviews: I love love LOVE Neo. I would probably be there more if it were closer to home. The Sakura shortcake and latte are mind blowing, perfect for this hot weather.

name: Z C
reviews: Coffee is drinkable, and cookies are good. Bizarre seating inside that forces you to straddle a bar to sit in front of a tiny table. It has some outlets for plugging in laptops, but tables are so tiny it's nearly impossible to work on the tables.

name: Jessica Z

name: Harry Wray
reviews: Aesthetic cafe with great pastry and drinks. I love the iced hojicha latte.

name: Joyce Quach
reviews: Fancy looking desserts with no flavors, unfortunately. I really wanted to like this place but it‚Äôs merely average in terms of taste and quality. I tried their Sakura latte, matcha blueberry muffin and almond croissant, all mediocre. Probably won‚Äôt go back anytime soon.

name: Hannah Jahanshahi
reviews: Hi Negar! Thank you for your review. Your comments have been shared with our upper management team as it is essential for us in improving our quality of service.

For drinks, I ordered a latte, which is also delicious.

name: Kate Hall
reviews: Coffee is one of the best in Toronto

name: Michael DeGross
reviews:
A cute little cafe with a very cute aesthetic! If I was still in school I could definitely see myself coming here, ordering a drink, and studying here.

I got the london fog latte, as it is one of my favourites to get right now. It was perfectly sweet and with the right amount of foam. My friends got iced hojicha and iced genmaicha, with a side of their sakura cake. Everything was just so cute. I really loved the aesthetic here!

name: Sanaz Noorizadeh
reviews:
(Translated by Google) Very good coffee! Sandwich with really good egg, outdoor seats, just a little lack of choice of dishes. Otherwise I recommend.

name: R. N.
reviews: great coffee & atmosphere, lots of seating, delicious sweets, friendly staff, open space & well ventilated. indoor & outdoor seating. ‚ú®

name: Brandon Poole
reviews: Fine quality. Delicious London Fog and lattes. Efficient friendly service. Nice modern atmosphere.

name: Helena Vo
reviews: nice bright place to study and chat! latte was not my favourite but i liked the breakfast cookie

name: Nora Mya A
reviews: Great spot to get coffee and do work. The baristas are good to chat with, and the desserts there are nice. I really like that they have a no laptop time from 12-4 on weekends so that you can find a place to sit , without worrying if someone on a laptop will leave soon.

name: Aleksandr Russell
reviews: The Americano is quite nice... Very elegant and modernized-looking coffee shop.

name: William Burke
reviews: Creative beverage selection, usually full of people. Average service.

name: Asma S.
reviews: Brewed coffee was pretty good, a little on the acidic side. The Sakura and Matcha lattes were quite nice, but I felt like the matcha flavour was lacking, slightly on the weaker side. The cherry blossom flavour was overpowered by the raspberry and ultimately just tasted like a raspberry latte with a hint of Sakura, and was a little too sweet for me. Overall for my first time there I did enjoy everything

name: H√©l√®ne B
reviews: I love Neo coffee bar! The first time I went there, I had a matcha that was recommended by a colleague. It was also my first time tasting matcha. It was so delicious and flavourful! The place is also really well designed. There was a coat rack near by to hang the coats and mufflers and it made sitting and chatting very comfortable! The staff is really courteous. I would highly recommend this place :)

name: Omid abd
reviews: Really good Sakura Latte! Be aware that their WiFi network kicks you off after 1 hour, with seemingly no option to refresh / reset

name: J.
reviews: I tried Neo at their other location before this one and I like both! It's a great cafe for a quick coffee or place to catch up with a friend. I got their Iced Americano and Sakura short cake. Coffee was very smoothüëåThe cake was soft and not overly sweet! üëç The interior had a lot of seating options with some large tables for groups and lots of small tables for individuals or duos. They also had a lot of outdoor seating.

name: Purple Chainz
reviews: We ordered cortado and cappuccino, both were very delicious! The portions was a bit small, but it tasted so good that you forget about the size! üòã ‚Ä¶

name: Matt IGS
reviews: Cute, bright place to hang out or to get some work done. They have tasty genmaicha, hojicha, and matcha drinks.

name: Real Reviews
reviews:
No more pour overs.  Instead, poorly crafted weakened blend coffee.  It‚Äôs a shame because they used to be a great place for regular coffee with premium beans.  Now, you need to just have an espresso or milk based espresso coffee which is basically the same as everywhere else.  Normal.

I used to drive half way across town to get here.  No point anymore.

name: Lidia K
reviews: Hi Michael! Thank you for your review. Your comments have been shared with our upper management team as it is essential for us in improving our quality of service.

name: Sandra Tanner
reviews: Highly recommended

name: Atheer
reviews: Sweetness of sakura latte was perfect for me and sakura cake was great to pair with it!

name: Conrad Chan
reviews:
(Translated by Google) This coffee shop located on Bay St in downtown Toronto is actually a branch. I remember going to the old shop in the early years. It is near George Brown College, and the old shop is relatively small.
This branch has a lot of atmosphere. As soon as you enter the store, you can feel the atmosphere of Japanese simplicity. Vertical grain wood strips are used as wall decoration, which is beautiful, chic and tasteful. There are enough guests, and the characteristic wooden table with log design is very large, and the whole feeling is very comfortable.
The cashier area is big enough, and the clerk is busy making coffee.
The eye-catching ones are colorful Japanese cake desserts. The roll cake selection is mouth-watering, and I immediately ordered a piece of [Maple Walnut Roll Cake] and added a cup of latte. Sit down and enjoy!
The cake looks good, the cream is not too sweet, and the taste is okay. The latte is smooth!
‚ùáÔ∏èIn general, I feel that both the environment and the production are pretty good. Many people take out desserts, next time you can try puffs and other Western-style buns. Good looks are pleasing to the eye!

name: Dennis Kwan
reviews:
Cute experience, but a couple of hiccups that made the visit regrettable.

Ordered a muffin and a slice of cake. Got two muffins and the wrong cake (wondered why the bill was more expensive than anticipated). What really threw me off were the employees doing food prep in the back while also texting on their phones ü§¢

name: Î∞îÎûåÍ≥ºÌï®ÍªòÏÇ¥Îπ†ÏßÄÎã§
reviews: Hi Brandon! Thank you for your review. Your comments have been shared with our upper management team as it is essential for us in improving our quality of service.

name: The Dude
reviews: Great spot and environment with excellent drink choices!

name: Eddietheegg
reviews: üëå ‚Ä¶

name: Kevin Chan
reviews:
Love it. Brewed coffee is hit or miss at most places, but it's always great here. Nice vibe and lots of seating. I haven't tried the food but it looks great. Espresso comes with sparkling water which is much appreciated.

I see not everybody agrees with the no-devices policy at certain times and the limited wifi, but I see it as a great and necessary way to keep customers moving and not taking up a seat for hours after buying one coffee. Even with those policies, it can be hard to find a seat with all the people using their laptops.

name: May Nguyen
reviews:
I first got introduced to NEO at their Frederick St location, which was great. However, the location on bay is completely OVERTAKEN by students (who are there just for how pretty the place is) to the point where one can‚Äôt drink their coffee in peace or even study/work. Service depends on who you‚Äôre being served by but overall it‚Äôs decent. The food and drinks are good and I love how they differentiate themselves from other coffee shops.
Message to owner: please expand the seating area!

name: Chloe Hsu

reviews:
I really like this coffee place, so far they make the best coffee I have tried in Toronto! I really enjoy their oat milk latte.

The staff is nice and helpful.
The place is very stylish and cozy, great atmosphere. I like the fact there's lots of light thanks to the bay windows. I do prefer this location compared to the other one on Fredrick str for this reason.
I just wish the tables of the seats around the wall where larger.

Also, they do have a changing table in the washroom, which makes a big difference if you're a parent and come with your baby üöº

Highly recommend!

reviews: I made the purchase and sat for work. Then I was asked to leave because they have a ‚ÄúSaturday policy‚Äù to ban people using laptop. I asked the logic behind that and want an exception. They say they want me to enjoy my coffee. I said I am enjoying my coffee. They say they want other enjoy their coffee. But then no one feels offended because I am using a laptop! Please. This is nothing about customer and nothing about coffee. You just want to have a higher turnover and don‚Äôt want people to sit long. Say it out loud. I want more money. You should feel shamed and embarrass, but that‚Äôs how you should feel when you have a disgusting business policy. Please respect your customer and let them voluntarily to follow.

--

name: Alejandro Meraz
reviews: One of my favorite places to grab coffee in the city. The coffee is wonderful and flavourful and they have a wide variety of coffee and tea based drink for those who want something else. The desserts are lovely and cute as well, I'd recommend their Lemon tarts or their Cookie choux. This is a pricy place so Id say maybe don't go everyday, it will break your bank. The tables are insanely small (with the exception of one large table) so don't even think about going their to do work or study. it gets quite busy, so you'll have to be lucky when looking for a table too. If you can grab a seat, the environment is great and it's the perfect place to chat with a new friend or catch up with an old one.

name: A O
reviews: Had a hard time locating it using Google Maps, the exterior of the shop is quite lowkey it‚Äôs easy to miss, but the interior of the shop is so beautiful! They have free wifi that you can use for just an hour or two.

‚Äî

‚Äî
heard that their hojicha latte is worth trying, so i‚Äôll be getting that when i come back! they also had other pastries and cake on display (that i definitely also want to try next time).

The quality of the coffee has correspondingly dropped significantly. Little treats and pastries are still good but coffee is now horrible. With time I'm sure the baristas will learn but for now, 3 stars is all we can muster.

name: Dale Kuda
reviews:
Hi Ncedile! Thank you for your review. Your comments have been shared with our upper management team as it is essential for us in improving our quality of service.
We would like to do everything possible to improve the experience you have had at our location. Could you kindly email us at customercare@kinkafamily.com so that we can turn this into a positive experience?

reviews: Nice little coffee shop. Tiny bit expensive for what you get though.

name: Matvey A.

reviews: After a couple of visits, Neo Coffee Bar really seems a great place to take a moment, to catch up, read and relax.

name: Kathleene Sim
reviews: Great coffee and service. Beautiful shop.

name: J
reviews: Some good-looking cakes over here.

name: Janet Yao
reviews:
I am a local here, so I used to go here alot. I can't even count how many times I visited this place. I used to love this place and  their coffee and I still love it, but I had several unpleasent experiences these days.

Their baristas were used to be polite and nice, but now they've changed. I asked for an iced americano and the barista didn't hear it right so they made a wrong coffee (an iced latte). I was okay with that and asked to make it again for me. But they never apologized or asked for a refund unless I told them to. I know it is just a few dollars but this is not right.. You should've gone ahead and asked your customer first that you charged more because you got wrong orders.
I got a refund and paid a right amount again, but the fact that I had to raise this up by myself without hearing any apologies from them is very disappointing.

I went this place a week later again to grab a coffee but the lady who worked there was not polite and nice at all. She was just staring at me when I stood in front of the cashier to order. What an awkward moment! She didn't asked me what to orser so I just told her my drinks and food. She didn't say a word...I don't feel welcomed in this place anymore and feel ignored. I understand that people have bad days, busy days or whatsoever but you should not bring your mood to your workplace and express that feelings to your customers. That's very unprofessional. I might not go back to this place for a while and instead will go to Jimmy's because their staffs are great and very professional.

name: em ily
reviews: Hi Kim! We thank you for taking the time to write to us. We wanted to let you know how sorry we are about this situation. It is our priority to provide excellent customer service, and we would like to learn more about what specifically happened. You can email us at customercare@kinkafamily.com, and we will do our best to rectify the situation. Thank you, and we hope to see you back at NEO COFFEE BAR soon!

Also, I asked to get the outside table cleaned but they never did.

One of the best coffee i had in toronto and great

name: Alexandra Kam
reviews: First time at their patios and looking forward to dine inside the bar in the future üßä‚òÄÔ∏è ‚Ä¶

reviews: The coffee is really good and so are the muffins. Not so happy with the cookies though

name: William Khalil
reviews: Great coffee and very friendly staff!

name: Aidan Spring
reviews: Got Uber Eats. Good quality and super tasty. My Tiramisu didn't make it standing upright and smooshed. Unfortunately NEO uses plastic shards on top of this cake labeling them. That got smooshed into the cake and got lodged in my throat. Really not a pleasant experience. Plastic labels should not go onto a pastry that is made to eat. I am still giving NEO a 4 star because I believe their things are tasty. But the Tiramisu was poorly executed. I hope you stop using plastic labels on top of food! You could really hurt someone with these practices.

name: Prashanth S
reviews: Had the yuzu salmon quiche and the iced coffee with cold foam. Both were really good! Friendly staff. Ate on the front patio where there are lots of spaces for two. Has a clean, modern bathroom. All you could ask for :)

name: DANIEL WEI
reviews: Had the best coffee yesterday, so came back today to have more great coffee and wonderful conversation with the Barista. Great start to my day:)üëè ‚Ä¶

name: Eric Choi
reviews: Great coffee & Macha cookies. Also good packaging.

name: Sayf Gani
reviews: Unfortunately the matcha cookies are not fresh. They crumble when you try to eat them. Please take a note from Butter Baker

name: Thays Brenner dos Santos
reviews: This location is near my workplace, so I make weekly visits. What really stands out to me at this location above every other cafe in the area is the service. Every visit is met with a warm, friendly welcome. The baristas give their undivided attention to each person who comes to the store, even if they are busy! It also doesn't take long for them to prep orders. They seem to be welcome to trying out customizations (provided that you aren't expecting extra ingredients for free of course). They sell coffee and a variety of Japanese teas, as they are a Japanese caf√©, by the cup and by the package. I personally enjoy the Kabusecha, and Iced Matcha/Hojicha Lattes with their Housemade Vanilla Syrup. They sell a few Japanese-inspired pastries, like croissants, cookies, muffins, with Japanese flavours like matcha, yuzu, etc. While they are good, none of them stand out to me. In terms of more filling food, they do sell sandwiches. Having tried their selection several times, I can confirm that I do not really like them as I find them to be too salty.

name: Carolina Rodriguez
reviews: Extremely slow and unorganized service....ordered 2 drinks 15min ahead of time, app said order was ready for pick up, showed up and they said they hadn‚Äôt started the order and need another 10min. There weren‚Äôt even that many customers in the store and three people working...the latte and London fog were also extremely watered down. Skip this place

name: Myra Pereira
reviews: Cream puff really nice. Need to go again to try more

name: John
reviews:
only place in the city with a genmaicha latte - highly reccomended! the toasted rice gives the drink a very rich savory depth. they also have all sorts of milk alternatives. i like that they change their desserts each month too. if they ever bring back the matcha molten lava cake - get it ASAP. their roll cakes have a luxurious mouthful - pistachio and black sesame especially.

my one complaint is that their cookies are dreadfully dry. i've been searching for the best matcha cookies and their matcha cookies are so far from ideal.

name: Perry
reviews: Great cold brew coffee and croissants, awesome staff.

name: Dam V
reviews:
Want to have ‚Äúthe‚Äù perfect latte or cappuccino? Head over to Neo coffee and order away! There‚Äôs parking space right outside, they follow COVID protocols and offer a great selection of desserts, cakes, muffins, croissants and more!
Their hot chocolate is okay-ish but coffees are really good and definitely a specialty!
Absolutely visiting again üíô

name: Zainab Uno
reviews: It's alright

reviews: It was nice üëçüèª that‚Äôs it. I love coffee I been in other places I am from Colombia which gives me some right to talk about coffee ‚òïÔ∏è so this was a nice coffee but I do not have more to say. reviews:
I love Neo!

Tried a lot of pastries and coffee/tea lattes from this place over the past year thanks to covid.

Recommend:
1. Hojicha tea latte. A lot of reviewers mention matcha but hojicha is wayy better than matcha. Their hojicha is pretty solid and authentic.
2. Espresso. Their beans are delicious and baristas know how to pull a perfect shot.
3. Cookies
Matcha cookies and dark chocolate sea salt! If you don't like overly sweet cookies, you will love cookies from Neo!

Not sure:
Roll cakes- so inconsistent when it comes to quality???? Sometimes they are amazing sometimes they are soggy and gross. Hope they can do betty quality control?
Choux: dry and tasteless. Sorry ü•≤... I wanted to love them.

name: Dan Y
reviews: Good coffee, a little pricey however.

name: Bianca Masudo
reviews: I've only tried the matcha so far and it was quite good. Def recommend this place for a quick coffee or to do work/study. It's clean, organized and has good vibes.

name: Dory Abelman
reviews: Coffee was not good. Had a chemical taste to it.

name: aka.foodiedreams
reviews: Drop by for a quick coffee break and picked up a slice of London fog cake. Cute Japanese caf√© with affordable price pastries.

name: Andy MS
reviews: Nice pastries and good coffee

name: Brandon Ng
reviews:
Very smooth espresso. I tried their Signature Neo Espresso and it was just the jolt I needed for the day! Pairs well with a cookie or muffin üôÇ
It is best to go early in the morning as there are not many people around. ‚Ä¶

name: Yunny Hou
reviews: Amazing Mocha Coffee.. this was my first time having coffee from this place, and oh my god, u have never had such tasty Mocha ever in Toronto.

name: Matcha Snob
reviews:
Pricey, IG-able Japanese style coffee shop.
INSIDE: Very few empty sits, tables are quite small (for 2 cups of coffee, or 1 laptop), not for big group.

MENU: very cute roll cakes, croissants & other pastries. Roll cakes are not that good, a bit DRY. But the Tiramisu is very creamy and refreshing.
*** They have new special menu every month.

DRINKS: the Matcha Latte I ordered is a bit plain, couldn't taste the matcha flavor in it. Not bad but nothing special.

OVERALL: good place to sit down & chat with ONE friend (not a group), but pastry & drinks are not special & a bit pricey.

* Fun fact: the place's belong to the same Kinka, Kinton Family

name: Yves L
reviews: almost croissants were delicious. flaky and not too sweet.

name: Victor Lunar
reviews: Unique and beautiful desserts. Coffee roast is sometimes too burnt for my liking

name: June Wang
reviews: Delicious roll cakes

name: Chusa Nguyen
reviews:
2020.10.10. A special date and a special coffee. A short walk in the afternoon because it was raining. A great coffee.

2020.09.20. Tge last stop today was to order, pickup, and deliver to the famillia a Hot Americano and an Iced Americano. Nice place. Good Coffee. They add water to the Americano to you satisfaction. A variety of desserts (cookies, muffins, croissants) and sandwiches on display. The location is very convenient for us 2min walk.

name: Islam Zaher
reviews: Nice location, pretty venue and good coffee but UNSECURE wifi network.

name: Richard Pimentel
reviews:
A great location and vibe for a nice coffee shop and mini desserts! It is really a great place to study or even go on a first date. It is a very earth tone vibe restaurant that has mini round single person study table. This location is quite popular and may get crowded but if you go early enough you will definitely get some peaceful time to yourself or a nice date with your significant other. I will always recommend this place and definitely visit again.

The only downside I can think of is that the prices are on the expensive side compared to other cafes. If they lower the price of their food items, it‚Äôs definitely a place to beat in downtown Toronto.

name: James Scott
reviews:
Stopping by this marvellous cafe was the best choice I made today. The coffees made by the barista, Christopher was fantastic. And Shingen Cream Tart recommended by James is definitely a must try if you ever visit Neo Coffee Bar in downtown Toronto.

Thank you for showing your great hospitality! Love your spacious patio as well as the relaxing atmosphere.

name: Emme Anderson
reviews: Nice cozy cafe. Great tasting coffee. The pastries are a bit on the pricier side but super fresh and tastes good. Quiet, perfect for studying or work. The patio area is surprisingly not that loud or disruptive considering it is right off Bay Street.

name: Nabil Zoldjalali
reviews: ~ For the love of god...please indicate the size of every beverage in the menu...my friend ordered me a Machiato and I received the equivalent of a dental rinse cup...It tastes great - highly recommend - please confirm size tho.

name: Mei Fong
reviews: My favorite place in the city to grab a matcha. Best matcha in Toronto! Smooth, tasty, not too sweet or too bitter, warm enough and perfect foam.

name: Julia Hovanskaya
reviews: Nice bar, relaxed .

name: Richard Sanasie
reviews: Good matcha. Bay St is ugly though.

name: Holly Whimsy
reviews: Love this place, the unique items, and calming atmosphere.

name: Karishma Rane
reviews: overpriced

name: Leo Twin Flame
reviews:
Service was good and the pricey pastries looked cute, but tasted mediocre. Likewise, the latte I got tasted very ordinary.

It's a chill spot to study or do work, however.

name: Nishwa Gardezi
reviews: Very clean. Polite staff.

name: Benita Lee Cassidy
reviews: Very slow service, especially since one staff member was sitting outside and another was prepping food in the kitchen. Both could see a long line of customers waiting and did nothing about it. The coffee is okay but definitely not worth waiting that long for.

name: Anderson Kelly
reviews: Great to see the place is finally reopening inside! my cappuccino was well made!

name: Mina T.
reviews: The original Neo in downtown remains one of the best shops in Toronto but somehow the flavours are not replicated here in Bay st area. The coffee technique is great but the beans this store has chosen tend to disappoint: a mild musty flavour. The foods as always are ludicrously overpriced..a tiny sliver of a salmon and tomato sandwich for 8.95 which in reality with taxes and tips is 12 bucks. I can get the entire loaf of bread, a bunch of tomatoes, and pickles and sauce for less than that price :) Some practical pricing wouldn‚Äôt hurt get more people consuming these things. Anyway good to have options in the hood but it‚Äôll be nice to have better coffee beans.

name: Kalisway
reviews: Nice coffee bar with interesting drinks to order, a clean facility, and great service

name: vincent richel
reviews: Love to study at this cute Cafe with yummy pastries and drinks!

name: BrontosaurusistheRealHero
reviews: A little bit on the pricier side but their matcha latte and Swiss roll cakes are delicious!

name: Lev Glick
reviews:
Amazing japanese style cafe to chill and study while enjoying a cup of warm Kyoto matcha latte! This cafe is located super close to downtown core, and they have a nice seating area for everyone for find a cute little table for themselves and study.

I also love their amazing pastries selection and handcrafted dessert cake rolls as well~ especially their monthly specials! I didn't get to try the cakes but ingot the spinach and feta pastry which was super super delicious! They warmed it up by request so I definitely recommend to warm it up for a crisp texture

Kyoto Matcha Latte - $5.95
Spinach and Feta Pie

name: Jensen
reviews:
Cute Japanese coffee shop! Love the clean and minimal aesthetic. Beautiful cafe for IG photos esp. since they have pretty big windows so the lighting is pretty good. Compared to their other location, this one seems much busier and there aren't as many seats so would recommend going during off hours to avoid the crowd or be prepared to wait a bit for a spot. I've tried quite a few of their pastries and cakes and don't think there have been any that I disliked but their monthly specials are much more memorable than their daily pastries and cakes. Neo is on the pricier side, but I think it's worth it given the quality and atmosphere.

On my most recent trip, I got their March special, the matcha yuzu tiramisu. It was absolutely delicious!  The yuzu takes center stage for this dessert; the matcha is more subtle and adds a nice earthiness to complement the tart flavour from the yuzu and sweetness from the cream. Love how the yuzu cuts the heaviness of the cream and adds such a refreshing flavour! Perfect dessert to celebrate the warm Spring weather! My only complaint is the size... I wish it was triple the size! Could eat at least three cups of these!  So yummy! ‚Å£

Highly recommend Neo!

name: Tina H
reviews: Just as good as the east side location, these guys do coffee and tea with a level of precision you don‚Äôt find anywhere else. Every time I come through Toronto I make a point to stop at one of their locations. I‚Äôd suggest you do the same!

name: Henry Zhang
reviews: Really great coffee, staff, and atmosphere! On the weekends from 12-4 they also have a no-laptop policy which makes it a really nice environment!

name: quanny
reviews:
Great coffee, decent pastries but was definitely disappointed by the croissant!

A little too dry and close to no almond filling, their muffins are excellent though

name: Araya Rimsamutchai
reviews: clean and neat. good array of croissants and baked goods with interesting flavors!

name: Elise ZiYuan Wang
reviews: So many yummy items. Free wifi and charging stations

name: Saku Hime
reviews:
The WORST coffee/ tea experience.
The coffee has burnt taste, which is ususally noticeable with the cheap coffee variations.
The Matcha Tea is only sweetened, very small and overpriced (over 6$).
The stuff is not cooperative. When asked to change the order, every small tweak has to be paid for.
The weekends reserved for non-laptop time, so it is impossible to study... and even during other days, the tables are a size of a pea.

NEVER recommend

name: Puffy Ofluffy
reviews: Probably the best coffee in Toronto, the staff are always happy and pleasant. A little on the pricier side but it's worth the premium.

name: Anton
reviews: This is an amazing place for a coffee lover. Beautiful and cleanly designed space with excellent coffee selection, lattes and desserts. They also had a killer katsu sando when I was there.

name: Í∞ïÎèôÌúò
reviews: Their cakes are to die for!

reviews: This coffee shop is spacious, architecturally beautiful and great coffee! Great atmosphere for doing work or catching up with a friend.

name: Harmony Granger
reviews: Amazing Japanese style cafe. They have month special every month, you should try those. They ambiance is very aesthetic & soothing.

reviews: It's okay, nothing special at all. Also, me and three other friends got the exact same drink with no modifications and were somehow charged different amounts before tip. Will not be returning.

name: Amin Rahmani
reviews:
This was the right place to walk into.
The friendly gent brewing the bean made such a good Americano, I had to stay and have another. Second one was iced since it was so hot out, perfect.
I mentioned to him how I liked that it wasn‚Äôt very acidic, and he pointed out some of the reasons behind it, which were very cool to learn.
Followed that up with the mixed berry muffin I had been eyeing earlier. It had a PROPER amount of berries, which is just the way I like it.
Even managed to get a good amount of work and reading done while listening to the very chill jazz playing in the background.
I‚Äôll definitely make this a regular hangout on my days in town. There are two more muffins I‚Äôm eyeing for my next visit :D

Enjoyed it with a Butter Tart(without raisins), the filling was a tad too sweet for my taste but fresh and good quality.
Overall, would surely revisit to try their other remarkable bean coffees :)

reviews: I like this place. The products are really delicious and they're all really fresh

reviews: I feel they are one of the best places to buy roasted coffee beans in Toronto. Good selection of beans  and roasts available. Their beans are my go to for the Aeropress. Food is also great. Service at this location is impeccable and staff here are very friendly.

name: Alejandra
reviews:
Out of all the pretentious Queen street coffee shops this is one I would urge you not to go here.

I‚Äôve been here several times in the last couple of months because I wanted to give them a chance but nope, still the same awful service every time.

I was just there and the person serving me clearly had no interest in being there and shows no service etiquette. My standards are not high, but all I‚Äôm saying is I‚Äôve received better service at Burger King.

I give them 2/5 because at the very least they have a good selection of food which most coffee shops nowadays don‚Äôt seem to offer.

I would be happy to come back to this Queen staple if their staff integrated manners into work ethic and accepting cash would be a plus!

reviews: Such a cool place for coffee of snack or baked goods!

I tried the shortbread cookies; they are thin and taste ok. I wouldn‚Äôt get it again, but the coffee yes!

reviews: They have the best whole bean coffee I‚Äôve fond in Toronto and they are very friendly and helpful!

reviews: Great place. I recommend the French vanilla latte on a cold day.

reviews: I don't get to the east side of Toronto to often, so I don't know the local shops as well. I popped into Remarkable Beam on a whim to pick up coffees for a client meeting. George (owner) was very friendly and accommodating. The coffee is great, and the homemade muffins are a great way to start the day. I'll be back next time I'm in the area!

reviews: Not only is this the BEST coffee in the area, the customer service is friendly, familiar and welcoming. Their treats are fresh and delicious and they‚Äôre serious about the quality of their coffee beans. Would highly recommend.

reviews: George is a solid guy. The coffee ‚òï  and vegan sausage roll is absolutely amazing. My new spot in the morning.

reviews: Delicious pastries and drinks!! Great service! Easy to purchase thru a window (great if you have a dog and cant come inside) üòä ‚Ä¶

reviews: Picking up my beverages here in their great little curb side hub during Covid in my neighborhood has made my days a little brighter. You guys make the BEST matcha latte in the area!

reviews: Great coffee and great atmosphere! Baristas very friendly and knowledgeable @

I‚Äôve never had a bad bag of coffee and everyone who drinks it comments how incredibly delicious it is. We just use it in a pour over and it works every time. Delicious! What a joy it is to receive a fresh bag of this coffee delivered to my door every week!!! Keep up the beautiful roast guys!!!

reviews: Stopped by for the first time yesterday morning since my power was out at home and got myself a coffee and one of the mini quiches. The coffee was great, and the quiche would have been if it wasnt still cold in the centre. The place is really cute but I found it odd that there was no background music going?!

reviews: Great coffee selection, roasted on site, friendly service. Cozy laid back comfortable  with super treats.

name: Nancy Macedo
reviews: Parking was tough to visit the Remarkable Bean. Our decision to still make attempts to stop and enjoy the coffee were based on other reviews and how highly other thought about the place. I found it really average. The place is cute and you can find seating but its awkward at times. I think the owner needs to review seating arrangements - there are definately ways to maximize space without compromising a cozy atmosphere. The coffee was good but was average. I got the rocket fuel coffee and a oatmeal cookie - just average and nothing else to write about. My guess is that its a good  neighborhood spot as it became a bit busy with 1 served who managed drinks, orders, and cash. However, I don't think I'll go out of my way again.

name: Edward Bennett
reviews: Good tea & coffee nice people.

name: Mike Riberdy
reviews: Great tasting coffee, nice little shop.

name: Ume Maharukh
reviews: Went to the Remarkable Bean for some iced coffee but unfortunately they currently dont have an ice machine :(. Ended up trying their vegan coconut walnut cookie and it was very nice! Hopfully they expand their vegan options. Great prices and lovely workers!

reviews: Always good. Keep up the great work!

reviews: Good coffee (even the decaf - had a flat white). Good music. Comfy seating. Wifi sketchy. Lovely friendly staff.

reviews: I buy a bag of Rocket Fuel about once a week. John remembers my name now. Peanut butter cookies - huge and deeeelicious. Be there early to get them. They don't make many and blink and they're gone.

name: Julian Sammy
reviews: The man behind the counter, out of the goodness of his heart, made me a little cup of tea as I was leaving. He'd heard me coughing earlier. That was on top of excellent coffe in a spacious, well maintained store. Oh - and the smell of roasting coffee in there and on the street? Amazing.

name: Desmond B
reviews: Dope ambience, great selection of teas and coffee, and their vegan broccoli cheese muffin is on point

name: Ryan Sim
reviews: Great coffee joint, good location. Go Friday nights for Mike Payne's amazing comedy show!

name: Danielle Tessaro
reviews: delicious coffee, friendly service, great location. Love this place!

name: Robert Smith
reviews: Delicious coffee

name: Sydney Westgate
reviews:
My family and I are frequent customers at the Bean both in Leslieville and the Beaches. Not only is the coffee AMAZING (they roast their own btw) but the desserts are delicious. I suggest trying the ButterTart, they are the best in town! They also have a wide range of gluten free products and some vegan which is nice to have :)

As I said before, the coffee is wonderful. The owner's, as well as one very charming barista with a mighty fine beard, roast their own beans in house. The coffee is strong, not acidic and smooth. Rocket Fuel is my go-to! The espresso is creamy with caramel undertones. Just by the taste of your drink, you know the roasting is done expertly and the staff are well trained when it come's to steaming milk and pouring espresso shots. The staff are also extremely friendly and quirky - don't let the sometimes sarcastic wit steer you away! The Remarkable Bean is certainly unique and the staff are no different. There is jazz music playing in the background and velvet purple, yellow and red pillows.

Everyone who goes to the Bean is also kind. You can certainly tell that in the Leslieville location, almost everyone is a regular and the owners are familiar with many of their customers. Speaking of the owners, the Bean is a family run company and if you are grabbing a coffee from either location you are bound to see them. They care about their store, their customers and their staff. They are, in my opinion, a very "hallmark" type of family and if you know hallmark, that means they are kind, charming and passionate about what they do.

If I was going to recommend a coffee shop in Toronto to someone, my first suggestion is always the Remarkable Bean! It may be located outside of the downtown core, but it's worth the trip! My family doesn't live in the area but still choose to swing by the bean when in need of a coffee-fix. Trust me when I say you can't go wrong :)

ALSO they have comedy on friday nights!! BONUS

name: jeremy yaksich
reviews: Comedy night every Friday! Can't miss! And free of charge. Awesome.

name: Aoiffe Walsh
reviews: Friendly staff, open late at night which is perfect for getting some work done. It‚Äôs a quiet spot that do good drinks. Every Friday evening they host a free comedy show which is worth checking out.

name: Dan Brennan
reviews: best mocha I ve ever had

name: Brigitte McCann
reviews: Cranberry blueberry muffins to die for. Very cozy and jazzy atmosphere with industrial type decor. Back patio for outdoor calm in the sun. Coffee lovers: I had their flat white and it was delish. Would definitely come back here!

name: Mo Chan
reviews: Great coffee

name: nicol cotton
reviews: good coffee and homemade snacks, nice vibe too.

name: Lara Saliba
reviews: A great cafe! It's a cute, cozy small design that draws you in and encourages you to settle in and set up shop with a good book or your laptop for a few hours. It's snug, warm, and the wood features and exposed brick wall add a nice style to the place. What stood out the most to me at this shop was the warm atmosphere and the friendliness - not only of the staff, but also of the other patrons! I got excited when I saw it as I thought the name was very adorable, and wanted to take a picture in front of it - I tried to be quick and not block anyone's way but people were also so nice and understanding!

reviews:
Went there for the first time today. Got a medium roast coffee (No light roast). It's pretty good. But the service was cold. No wave no thank you and I wasn't done paying that the next person was being served. (1 or 2 person behind me).

Thing is, there's like 3 coffee shops within 2mn walk from this place that look all equally good. So while I gave it 4 stars, I'm not sure it really deserves it.

name: Andrea H
reviews: Very nice coffee shop on Queen East in Toronto.  Good quality coffee and a nice, comfortable area to sit and enjoy, along with one of their tasty pastries, of course!

name: Gaby Abed
reviews: Good

name: Vincent Mok
reviews: Pretty good coffee, chill vibe

name: Yechan Lee
reviews: Original review: Would be a great coffee shop if the staff was a bit less wiseass.  Coffee is good however and there's usually free samples if you can take the wisecracks that come with. Review one year later: offending person no longer employed it seems. Attended excellent comedy event here.

name: Niall Quinlan
reviews: Love this location! Cozy and neatly decorated space, warm and friendly staff, good selection of beverages, and the homemade snacks are delicious.

name: Walid Saleh
reviews: Super friendly staff

name: Hayden Lives
reviews: There are much better coffee shops in the neighborhood.  The service is usually mediocre,  the buttercup that I've tried was really dry and untasty.  The coffee is OK and the kishes and the muffins are nice.

name: Christophe F.
reviews: Good coffee, quiet space good for conversations

name: Carlton C
reviews: The place was cozy and awesome, but I felt like there is a little shortage of matcha latte. I tried matcha latte, and it was the worst latte I have had before. I don't know how taste the coffe is, but I don't wanna recommand the match latte.

name: The Talos Team in Toronto by Andreas and Nectaria (Nectaria & Andreas)
reviews: Love the vibe in here, a real east side great. The savory muffins are a must

name: Nectaria Kladitis
reviews: Service was friendly & competent. Wares were worth the outlay of cash. Comfortable environment.

name: Anca B
reviews: Friendly staff. Great environment. Good muffins. Only knocked off a star because no latte art.

name: Brian Kennedy
reviews: Excellent coffee and delicious quiches with a nice selection

name: HARRIS LAM
reviews: Best coffee roasted on site baked goods made fresh and delicious every day

name: Aura Events
reviews: Great atmosphere and INCREDIBLE coffee. Working in this area for a few months and have made this a part of my routine. Get one of the muffins.

name: Mike Heron
reviews: Friendly folks making good coffee.  Plenty of room.  What else does one need?

name: Sarah Bruckschwaiger
reviews: Best coffee place everrr

name: Kitzen Hayden
reviews: Best coffee in the beaches hands down.  Their medium americano can't be beat!!

name: Mark Bolusmjak
reviews: Delicious drinks with lots of room to sit and enjoy the atmosphere.

name: Priscilla Mak
reviews: Best coffee in Leslieville- I always buy some for housewarming gifts wherever I go and people are really impressed! Great staff, awesome treats. Wouldn't recommend it for sitting and reading or working/studying however- the music is consistently awful, never changed (I've heard the same group of old CDs repeat 3 times in one afternoon type of thing) and volume is set very loud. I bring my noise cancelling headphones and try and make-do because I love the place so much lol

name: Kathy Nga Ting Ho
reviews: The big tables are great for getting work done

name: Andrea (LabyrinthOnVHS)
reviews: Good lord the baked goods are amazing. The Remarkable Baked Goods didn't have the same ring or didn't fit on the sign. All hail the bean's quiche! See also: chocolate chip muffin et al.

name: Pedram D.
reviews: Great coffee, good selection of treats and lunch items (sandwiches, quiche, etc.) Good reasonably quiet place to get some work done.

name: Andreas Batakis
reviews: Friendly service, delicious fare

name: Mike Lee
reviews:
Fantastic service! Te Aro is just always busy so I ventured eastward and fell in love. It's a simple coffee shop with really good pastries. There's good coffee. And there's sandwiches!

The barista actually took the time to explain each bean to me, from harvesting to drying to roasting to flavour profile. EACH bean!! He made sure I picked the right one.

name: Gillian Raymond
reviews: A quiet and cozy spot with fantastic coffee.

name: Spencer Clerk
reviews: Nice cozy place in Leslieville. Relatively good coffee and delicious treats and pastries. Secure wifi, clean bathrooms!

name: Matt Li
reviews: Good coffee, yummy cakes (had a carrot cake. Hmmm!) Nice atmosphere and cool staff. Although s bit hipster audience - but one has to take that for some decent places theses days ;)

name: Sara Bobinac
reviews: This is my personal favorite cafe in Toronto. Nice coffee, nice staff - especially Remarkable John! It is laid back and friendly.

name: Markus Weisshaar
reviews: Decent espresso, lots of savory treats, open late. Service was a bit awkward.

name: Chris Brown
reviews:
Glad to see a RB open up closer to me (not a huge fan of the one in the Beaches).
2 experiences here:
One during this past winter; the staff was excellent, friendly and made a great coffee! we had lattes and sausage rolls to refuel after a long (and cold) run. We were able to find a seat even though it was busy.
One during this past summer; Iced tea was really good (they brew it as you order) but the staff seemed to be new and a bit unsure of them self. The drinks took a long time.

name: Miguel Agawin
reviews: Food is okay. Quiet place to grab coffee in Leslieville.

name: Peter Fung
reviews: Great service, great iced coffee. The day we were there was a pretty slow day so the comedian behind the counter was keeping the spirits light and entertaining us. He made a damn good iced coffee as well. We tried some sweets; a brownie and butter tart, and although the butter tart was a bit too dry the brownie was great. We went to the back patio which was empty to our surprise, on such a nice day. Would go here again!

name: balanced paws
reviews: Friendly crew

name: Steve Keys
reviews: Dark roast is nice and mild. Good quiches and very comfortable place to work.

name: Henry Lu
reviews: Could you name a cozier coffee shop with more exceptional service in the east end? Tripped in here with my crew and Jason treated us like old friends. The dude takes his coffee and other beverages seriously. Keep spreading them good vibes!

name: Vasily Giannakeas
reviews: Appreciate you taking the time to share Henry ‚ò∫Ô∏èüôèüèΩ

name: Dasong Zou
reviews: Great coffee, great vibes. Employees are very friendly :)

name: Frank L (Syncros)
reviews: It a great place for coffee, energy drink, healthy snack. Must Visit often. The staff are friendly and helpful.

name: Sam
reviews: Appreciate it, Dasong üëçüèΩ

name: Jennifer Csatlos
reviews: They just opened but are a great addition to the neighborhood.   They're brewing using quality beans from Detour. They knew how to make a proper Cortado, which was just what I was looking for.

name: S W
reviews:
Let's be Frank...Cortado is my fav üòâ

reviews: This was my first time visiting Simple Coffee and it was a great experience!  Jason, the Owner is super friendly and provides a warm welcome. I highly recommend the blueberry scone. It was not overly sweet which I liked.   I also really enjoyed the cappuccino I had.  I would definitely return.

name: Jens Christian Roth
reviews:
Highly recommend!
