I opted in for an oat milk latte and almond croissant.
Latte was very nice and creamy (i would say velvet-like). The croissant was amazing, I was so surprised by how delicious it was, I will 100% be back.

name: Parameshwaran Ayyar
reviews: Fantastic coffee and treats. Staff are very friendly! Anyone looking for good coffee or tea-based drinks should check out this place.

name: Maddison L'Estrange
reviews: Great coffee spot

name: Catherine Kazmir
reviews: Really great coffee and fantastic owner. Can only recommend üôèüèª All the best from the Danes ‚Ä¶

name: Glenn Gustafson
reviews: Fantastic little gem at Queen and coxwell. Jason and his team were exceptional. The coffee , muffins and croissants were amazing!

name: Aaron Siebenga
reviews: Lovely owner with great coffee!

name: Jodie Grieve
reviews: Our favourite neighborhood coffee shop. Jason and his staff are super friendly and the food/drink are tasty too!

name: Zander Milroy
reviews: Good coffee, tasty croissants, and friendly service. Everything you need in your first stop of the day.

name: Timothy Roy Walks
reviews: Small cool shop, love coming here before I catch the streetcar.

name: Abbas Hassuji
reviews: Just had an amazing dirty chai latte with oat milk from here! Our barista was really nice and chatty and definitely knew what he was doing when it came to the coffee making :)

name: Katelyn
reviews: The name says it all... Except, that it's simply delicious coffee ‚òï

name: Kristen W
reviews: Happy to hear you enjoy our coffee as much as we do üòâ

name: MW Moskalyk
reviews: Thanks Matt ‚ò∫Ô∏è

name: Patricia Buchner
reviews: Hey Katelyn, thanks for your review. Let us know what we could have done better.

name: Matthew Garrett
reviews: thank you üôèüèΩ

name: Raina H
reviews: My fianc√© and I used to come here weekly when we lived in the beaches. The coffee is amazing but Jason is the true star here. I recommend this place to anyone and everyone.

name: Mitchell Butler
reviews: Thank you Nic. I hope you guys are enjoying Sweden üá∏üá™‚úåüèΩ

name: Ayelet Meir
reviews: Thank you üòä Albert

name: Eswan Flores
reviews: Simple Coffee is a new ritual in the Beach. The coffee is amazing, the local community is inviting, and Jason is an incredible barista. The new wooden seating area outside really sets the tone of the morning coffee, with nice logs and garden greens. Thanks for everything.

name: Marc Pardy
reviews: Happy to hear you enjoyed the coffee and our CafeTO street patio. ‚úåüèΩ

name: Colin Johnson
reviews: ü§≠ thank you

name: Rob Hicks
reviews: So happy to have this great spot in the neighborhood! Good quality coffee and a great selection of baked goods.

name: Paul
reviews: The coffee is amazing, but the real gem of the place is the owner Jason. Just a top quality genuine guy, always a great experience coming to Simple Coffee :)

name: Bridget Kalinauskas
reviews: Ordered coffee for all our department. Got a cappuccino and a Cortado. Very good after taste, and smelled amazing! Simply great coffee‚Ä¶haha I had to üòÇ (pardon my dad jokes)

name: Rikki Gibson
reviews: So good. I drive by this place all the time and had to try it out.  I ordered the flat white and by far the best one I‚Äôve ever had!!!!

name: James Kennedy
reviews: Great flat white. Really cool owner

name: Emma Heutschi
reviews: We were here for the weekend from Montreal and staying at an Airbnb nearby this cafe became our spot in our short time here. Great lattes, super friendly staff and amazing cookies and scones. I will definitely be back next time I'm in town.

name: Jeff m
reviews: Don't typically write reviews, but this place is simply great! Just moved into the neighbourhood and thought I'd give it a try. Was nice to meet and chat with the owner. Coffee tastes GREAT - exactly what I was craving, and the croissant was flakey fresh with a light sweet glaze on top. Simple Coffee is a fitting name for this little gem of a spot; simply cozy, simply friendly, simply tasty.

name: Clement Law
reviews: Great atmosphere, cowboy cookies are 10/10.

name: S B
reviews: Super friendly staff. Great matcha latte. Highly recommend.

name: Robin Pamayah
reviews: Great coffee and super friendly staff!

name: Matthew Lawson
reviews: Excellent coffee and service!

name: Rodney Lau
reviews: Amazing experience. Very kind and thoughtful service, delicious coffee and best croissants!!!  I‚Äôm so glad to have found a gem like this, highly recommend!

name: Daniel Jack
reviews: Best service and coffee

name: Mina Tawadrous
reviews: Amazing food and very friendly staff!

name: mitchvoll
reviews: Best cookies I‚Äôve ever had.

name: Jenelle Fondeur Cruz
reviews: Great coffee and scones, very friendly staff.

name: Geoff Stuart
reviews: Always great coffee/espresso, and really tasty baked goods as well

name: Dexter Hinkson
reviews: Good coffee, nice owners, good to chat with.

name: Rabab Jahan
reviews: Fantastic service, quality coffee, beautiful latte art, nice patio

name: Abby L
reviews:
Great place with great staff. Friendly and inviting. Walked in with the kids and had a good variety of cookies / baked goods.

I ordered the mocha and to my surprise they used actual chocolate and not just the powdered stuff which definitely was a noticeable taste difference.

Great place!

name: Tracy Smiley
reviews: Great coffee and service! We'll definitely be back :)

name: Alana Gregoire
reviews: Best coffee in the beaches area! Amazing service as well

name: Daniel Molnar
reviews: Coffee was so well brewed, loved the place‚ù§

name: Michael Burgess
reviews: Tasty iced americano ^_^ really good service as well.

name: Aaron Binder
reviews:
Exceptional coffee.

Exceptional service.

Exceptional vibe.

Simply Exceptional!

I highly recommend!!!

name: Niall Collins
reviews: Amazing coffee and amazing people! Really love this place and appreciate the friendliness of the staff :)

name: Bohemian Life
reviews:
Travelled from the far north and needed a good cup of coffee to treat myself. Didn't want to go to any of the chain places so went here. Run by two excellent guys who will provide you with excellent coffee and an excellent chat.

Keep it up guys!

name: Nam H
reviews: Best coffee in the area!

name: Patty Sachamitr
reviews: We picked up a latte and a mocha to go this morning - absolutely delicious! Lovely chat with one of the owners as well. Definitely a place to stop in any time we pass by.

name: Kayla Preston-Lord
reviews: Sorry to hear about your window, our store was also broken into by the same person.

name: Allison Morrow
reviews: Great coffee, super nice and friendly staff, would definitely recommend to anyone and everyone looking for a nice, local coffee shop

name: Martha Stanley
reviews: Great beans and a barrel of laughs (no charge) everytime I pop by!

name: Bubs Arcade Fighters
reviews: Great little Gem. Tasty cappuccino, reasonable price, doesn't charge you extra for things such as almond milk. ‚òï Cappuccinos are served considerably hotter than any other typical coffee shops. Which is a good thingüëç. Service was pretty fast as well. Oh, and extra shot of espresso is just +50c üåüüåüüåü ‚Ä¶

name: SHARON
reviews: Great service and coffee options.

name: Crystal Correa
reviews: Fantastic Coffee and Biscotti! Really quick service and the perfect cappuccino!  So happy thi is around the corner!

name: naima karp
reviews:
Lovely spot! Woke up this morning and realized I was out of coffee so I stopped in quickly on my way to work, uncaffinated and a little grumpy. Found myself with a much needed cup of coffee and nice chat with the staff member. Cheered me right up and again later on in the day when I ate the delicious peanut brittle cookie I picked up as well!

Highly recommend!

name: Marcus Smith
reviews: Jason & Sebastian are super friendly, passionate and knowledgable about coffee :) They did a great job with the former convenience store space. Integrate getting a cuppa from this spot into your LCBO / Pet Valu / beach jaunt runs. I'm drinking to their success, hope to see this place getting slammed this summer! <3

name: Erika
reviews: Excellent espresso and tasty fresh baked goods!

name: Ben Mo
reviews: Definitely recommend this place! The atmosphere is very chill and the staff is super friendly and welcoming. Their London Fog tea latte is the best I‚Äôve had, and their Mocha is fantastic as well.

name: nathaniel fleming
reviews: Great place!!! Good coffee and my server was extra nice and helpful. My go to coffee place before work!

name: Dale Street
reviews: i went to this coffee shop just out for a walk i had to try and the staff were so polite nice place as well ia'm so glad that your in the neighbor welcome

name: Jennifer Wallace
reviews: We visited Simple Coffee yesterday and the two gentlemen were absolutely delightful. Thank you for your friendly service, lovely tea latte and the delicious biscotti, it was a pleasure!

name: Hayley Pitcher
reviews: This place is fantastic! great place to grab a coffee and have a quick chat if that's what you're into. If you're more into brevity, they have ritual right at the door. super efficient. super good. PS croissants are amazing.

name: Tim Martin
reviews: First time seeing this place! Lovely drip coffee and human serving it

name: Kyle Grondin
reviews: Great coffee, knowledgeable staff! So happy they're in the neighborhood.

name: Marissa Grubb
reviews: It's pretty blessed. The mandems that run it are pretty sweet looking.

name: Ryan Stephenson
reviews: Really pleasant shop with excellent coffee!  The owner was very kind and took the time to chat with my husband and I.  It's been great getting to know local shops.  We'll definitely be back again!

name: Steven Tse
reviews:
It‚Äôs a very nice experience just going to this coffee spot.
So friendly and nice, plus omg their latte‚Äôs are amazing
This is now my only go to place and I wouldn‚Äôt change a thing

name: Alicia Leung
reviews: Coffee is great, so is the biscotti. Prices reflect the area for espresso. Always a smile and a chat when you're in there + dog friendly! A welcomed addition to the neighborhood.

name: Chester Hansen
reviews: Very nice owners and very good coffee. Give this place a shot if you are ever in the beaches

name: Rebecca Hopkins
reviews:
So happy to have a great new coffee shop just up the street from work! Decided to treat myself to a nice cappuccino today and it didn't take much convincing to try one of the butter tart bars which is also delicious!

Will definitely be back soon :)

name: Jim Lockington
reviews:
A great place for breakfast and lunch.
On a cold day, don't sit near the windows. üò¨

name: Pierre Hiegel
reviews: Service was great but the food was awful. Rarely had such a disgusting dinner !

name: Jason G
reviews: A nice diner in the beach. Not much to be said about the atmosphere but you will get a decent meal at a reasonable price

name: Shane Kennedy
reviews: Nice spot for a quick bite to eat. I got the all day breakfast and it was ok. Nothing special but enjoyable. The staff are very nice and the prices are ok for Toronto. Would visit again but wouldn't get the all day breakfast again.

name: Nikolas Koschany
reviews:
It pains me to leave this review, as the Beacher Cafe is a neighbourhood institution. However, the last time we were here, the service took forever (we learned there was only one cook in the kitchen) and the food took forever to arrive and was sadly mediocre.

This does not have to be fatal, but the restaurant needs to make some improvements to regain our trust.

name: Sandra Riley
reviews: Food was ok. They didn't make my eggs right. A bit over-priced in my opinion. Loved the atmosphere

name: K M
reviews:
Had a great breakfast with my daughter, really nice vibe and menu.  The burger was solid but my daughter doesn‚Äôt do toppings so just mind that in the photos.

The only downside is that by the time brunch was done, I was  questioning my Toronto choices in life and consumed with the idea of fleeing midtown, moving out to the beaches, meeting my new neighbours and knowing their names.  Great spot but be careful.

name: Darrell Balsor
reviews: Good food friendly service a bit pricey for breakfast but it was clean and washrooms were clean also I gave it a 4 mostly for price

name: Jodie Mulder
reviews: Delicious breakfast. Great service

name: Farah Arsbi
reviews: Honestly the extra star is only because our server was so nice and welcoming but the food was a complete waste of money. We got the char-grilled chicken burger and the banquet burger and they were both tasteless and so soggy that the bun fell apart.

name: Tercio Rodrigues
reviews: Two times now and just not very good. Much better breakfast joints nearby and most cheaper too. Only good thing is there is usually a place to sit but otherwise meh.

name: traci dixon
reviews: Always a good breakfast a day great service!

name: Sam John
reviews: Great service. Good food!

name: VladaTV
reviews: Overall ok experience. Good for breakfast,  portions should be bigger however there is some good food there. Need furniture replacement from inside. Patio small but ok view.

name: s ali
reviews: fun

name: Markus Airelius
reviews:
Food and service was bellow average.
This place doesn't look like it's been renovated since the 80's lol
Patio in the summer is nice.

name: Lynda Cormier
reviews:
(Translated by Google) Excellence in service.

(Original)
Excellence du service.

name: Jules Bedeau
reviews: Great service and great food. The staff are lovely.

name: BH
reviews: Enjoy the staff, the food is ok

name: spectraconn consulting
reviews: Good service 3with a friendly wait staff and the food was lovely.

name: Kai Star
reviews: Not bad, a little too pricey now from when i used to come here but the food stays consistent

name: Karla O.
reviews: Brunch here is amazing. The French toasts and the eggs benedict are delicious. I'm definitely coming back.

name: Rocco DV
reviews:
Good food and friendly staff.

Huge selection. Will definitely go again.

name: Roland Kirschner
reviews: Overpriced even without 4% inflation.

name: Billie ‚ÄúZaiden‚Äù Chrysler
reviews: Not impressed. Food was overpriced and nothing special.

name: Marco
reviews: Breakfast was bad. Mediocre meal, and the potatoes were undercooked but also a bit burnt with no flavour. They were apologetic and provided good service.

name: Daniel Lee
reviews: Ordered a pitcher and lollipop chicken, waited an hour only to be told they ran out of lollipop chicken!  Long wait times and slow service.

name: Omar Wagih
reviews:
Food came out 15-20 mins apart, subpar quality - nothing fantastic, servers were nice but not very responsive. ‚ÄúInflation tax‚Äù is a joke on the receipt.

Used to be a nice place, I think they recently sold the place or replaced the management and it‚Äôs been downhill since.

name: Valentino Ruffo
reviews: terrific. great service great food.

name: Anne-Marie Brouillet
reviews: Lots of variety of ice cream right on the boardwalk and many tables with shade !

name: Kathryn Broome
reviews: Limited menu. They no longer serve mussels üò™. I LOVE a watermelon, cucumber & feta salad so I ordered it but instead of a balsamic reduction dressing they served it with maple syrup. YUCK!!!!

name: Susan Sykas
reviews: Great all day breakfast. Healthy options.

name: David Jonker
reviews: One of favourite brunch spots in the beach over the years. Great for families with younger kids. Often busy on the weekends but their service is relatively quick and they have a lot of tables so it‚Äôs rare to have to wait  a long time to be seated.

name: Heather Pryce
reviews: Excellent food great breakfast. It wasn‚Äôt overly BREAKFAST !  If you know what I mean

name: Tamar B√†rroussa
reviews: Great place, and glad it's back up and running! Missed this place!

name: Amanda-Ellen Gibbs
reviews: Best eggs Benny in the city. Nichelle who works there is a doll and looks after everyone so attentively and kindly. I‚Äôve been going to the Beacher since I was 11 at St.Denis, its never changed (in the best way possible!!). And please never do!

name: Ryan Magder
reviews:
Stopped by for Father's day around 10am.  Sign outside the restaurant mentioned a 25-minute wait for food, no problem, we continued on in and got a table with no issue. After ordering we waited an hour for food. Food arrived cold (eggs, bacon, sausages, potatoes), we ate it because we were starving at that point, understanding that if we sent it back we would likely be waiting a long time for the food to return.

Manager (we assume, she is decision maker for hiring) asks how the food was. Gave her our honest feedback about the long wait and food quality, I'm honestly not sure how the food could arrive cold unless it was sitting at the window for a while. For what it's worth, the service was good and we were able to get refills on our drinks (2nd star for service).

I understand restaurants being understaffed (sure, it happens!), but I'd rather that they communicate it realistically beforehand (i.e., write on the sign out front the wait for food is 45 minutes - 1 hour). We heard other nearby tables with small children asking about the arrival of their food. We were told they'd give it 200% next time, no amendments to the bill were made. Sorry, there will probably not be a next time.

name: Jonathan Doyle
reviews:
Potatoes weren't seasoned
Eggs and toast were cold
Sausages cooked so long the skin was leathery.

The very friendly server asked how the meal was. I told her the above information.  She brought my bill at full price...which...fine, I did eat most of it and I still tipped 15% because as I said to her...not your fault, these things happen.

I was fine to leave it at that and not review but I asked for a refill on my coffee in a to go cup and after paying for my bad meal in full, she told she would have to ring up a new coffee.

I told her not to bother and would tell anyone reading this also not to bother.

Really disappointing

name: littleyirkie
reviews: Good spot, good times.

name: Michael Loyst
reviews: Really disappointed. $15 breakfast and this is the portion they give for bacon. That was after waiting nearly 30 minutes for food. Eggs were delicious, bacon was clearly a low sodium version and tasteless.

name: Derek Lamers
reviews: One of my families go to brunch locations. Always great breakfast food and very kid friendly. I will continue coming here for brunch when I'm in the beaches!

name: Michael cross
reviews: Great staff, great food highly recommend

name: Breanne Marie Peacock
reviews: I love The Beacher Cafe. Growing up in the Beaches, I went here often with friends and family. I stopped by on Victoria Day to show some family outside of Toronto the Beaches. We sat on the patio to enjoy desserts and coffees. Namely, we really enjoyed the cr√®me br√ªl√©e and cheese cake. The service was very friendly. I would always recommend someone to stop by. If you‚Äôre looking for breakfast or brunch, my personal favourites are the eggs Benedict and their big traditional breakfast.

name: Mark
reviews:
Could be better if they didn't skimp on the portions. Prices not cheap be prepared to spend more than normal.
Servers were excellent üëè ‚Ä¶

name: John Andrews
reviews: I've been going to The Beacher for some time but the last couple of visits there have been sub par. The interior in winter months tends to be below room temperature, but more than that, the portions have become noticeably smaller, particularly the home fries with the eggs benedict - easily half the size the order was previously. The past two times have been bad experiences. One we waited almost an hour for our food which was also disappointing and yesterday, May 20, we tried again and my wife's omelette was stone cold, as were her home fries. We complained the the waitress took it back to the kitchen and when it returned, yes it was hot but flavourless. She said the best tasting part of her meal was the toast. That's it Beacher... we're done. Never coming back... lots of other places in the Beach that would be happy to have our business and give us value for money. AVOID

name: kaeli
reviews: Service took forever , food was undercooked, bland and honestly not worth the wait.

name: Timothy Ho
reviews:
Servers were friendly and efficient. The food was nothing exceptional but fair. Was a bit concerned when I heard somebody‚ÄîI assume the owner‚Äîscolding one of the servers for doing something incorrectly.

The bill was also a bit of a surprise with their made up ‚ÄúInflation‚Äù tax. Mixed feelings about this considering their prices were already a bit high for what we got.

Overall, great service, food ok.

name: Justin Aubut
reviews: I made and delivered 2 picnic tables for this restaurant and the owner gave me and my son free lunch. It was without a doubt the best brie burger I have ever had! Definitely going to take the whole family next time. Thanks Peter!

name: Dan Dallaire
reviews: This place has my vote for 5 stars, and take in a walk down to the beach afterwards, one of the nicest beach areas.

name: Jeff Neidhardt
reviews: Coffee was amazing!

name: Teresa Zhang
reviews: Hey Bleacher Cafe, went there today, and loved the food as per usual, great atmosphere, however I have noticed an extra "inflation" charge on the bills.  I totally get it, with current economic environment and inflation on everything, it is necessary to charge clients the extra amount to ensure your restaurant's survival.  However the only suggestion is perhaps to make a note on the menu stating the % charged to stay a float or have your friendly waiting staff to inform the table. I would be happy to pay for it, it just came to me on my bill as a surprise a had no idea how much was being charged.  Other than that, I am happy to be a patron again at your establishment, b/c I love that quiche you served today.  Thank you!! Would be happy to join the restaurant again soon!

name: Dave Welton
reviews: By far, the most abusive owner I have ever worked for.

name: Joey Thompson
reviews: Perfect!

name: Emily Robertson
reviews:
Came for my partners birthday for a quick brunch and was definitely a bit of a subpar experience.

Food was alright but not great for the price. Eggs in my order were made incorrectly, and I had to send them back sadly. The home fries are huge chunks of soft potato, some not even cut. The bacon and eggs were extremely oily‚Ä¶ a bit disappointing.

Our server was nice, and tried to be as accommodating as possible, but she seemed really frazzled. She had to drag around a huge sandwich board with the specials with her all over the restaurant? We felt bad she had to do that just to tell us the specials‚Ä¶ ??

Lastly a few feet away from us on a table in our section was a huge box of cat litter‚Ä¶ so strange. Definitely weird to have out during brunch service.

name: Tony Bitzionis
reviews: Good place to go in the rain. Wish they would bring back the draft beer.

name: Katharine Murphy
reviews: Thank you for your kind words Peter.

name: Bran Thayalaseelan
reviews:
This place should exist under different ownership or management. A breakfast diner of this sort is much needed in the neighborhood but not one that is as poorly managed.
I guess I'm viewing this more as a restaurant entrepreneur than a patron. The food program is actually not terrible so that's why they don't receive a 1 star review from me (which I so badly want to give).

name: da Pat
reviews:
I am very willing to sell you this restaurant and you can take the next two and a half decades to make great service and profits.  I am available to speak directly everyday at The Beacher Cafe
Peter

name: Justin Liberman
reviews: There are Diners and there are breakfast places. Breakfast places add a little something extra that makes the food tastier, surrounding cozier, and service a notch friendlier. Beacher's Cafe is a great breakfast place with a healthy menu great variety. Go for the eggs Benedict!!

name: Patrick Hodgson
reviews: We've been to The Beacher Cafe several times now and it never disappoints. Great low key vibe with a straightforward menu and friendly staff. The food is nice and the place is in a great location on Queen St East. Highly recommend for the neighborhood!

name: Manuel R Avila
reviews: Loved the tuna melt, was delicious and service was great. Great history and a nice patio, recommend you come by for a meal sometime!

name: Frederick Hannah
reviews: It took almost an hour to bring our brunch (poached eggs and a quiche), the quality of the food was below average, the waitress first gave us a lecture about how the refill coffee we got (which tasted awful) was by accident as they don't do free refills. When we finally received our order it was the wrong order (another table), then when our order came I had the wrong side... And their prices are a bit too much for a brunch place. Not going back for sure.

name: Jacob Mitchell
reviews: Always excellent food. Fantastic service.

name: Scott Ford
reviews: Good food and friendly staff!

name: Mayassi Kayed
reviews: Solid if sonewhat regular offerings, decent service, nothing remarkable either way.

name: vincent montagnac
reviews: Nice spot for a bite while out for a walk on the boardwalk.

name: Teagan Martins
reviews: Every time I go in there Amazing Star amazing food an amazing drinks can I get much better highly recommended

name: janet chappell
reviews: Sooooo yummy!

name: Ryan Thurston
reviews:
Servers excellent..attentive and friendly.
French toast the best I've ever had.

name: Franz Yagin
reviews: Went there this morning and got the Traditional Breakfast. 10/10 with great service. Highly recommended.

name: Barb Greco
reviews: Musty, cold and unsanitary. Orders came and other than the eggs, everything else was either stake or undercooked.

name: Jamie Maxwell
reviews: The Beacher delivered on food and service -- above my expectations. We were a small family group with two elderly family and came for brunch. The Beacher staff were accommodating and attentive. We were treated like gold and given a prime table: my mothers special order was not a problem. They answered all our questions about the menu and food came fresh, hot, and plentiful. I enjoyed the Eggs Benjamin. My family were enthusiastic about the fries (crispy and creamy inside) and the cajun chicken caesar. I highly recommend this Beach landmark

name: Mitchell McIvor
reviews: Food was good. Enjoyed getting out onto a patio one last time, before the winter arrives.

name: Kiron Noon
reviews: Great spot to eat, awesome community vibe. Breakfast was very good and service was as well.

name: Liam Grey
reviews: We ordered before other people and we‚Äôre still served after others, it took 30 mins for 2 juices even though they were not busy at all. And even we ordered take away and yet they have to to us in dine in. Juices taste below average

name: Kenny Huang
reviews: Delicious classic brunch options, attentive service.

name: Andre Lefkimmiatis
reviews: Excellent food and service

name: Matthew Stevens
reviews: Andre, thank you so much for giving us a chance to serve you.   We are grateful for any input.  Forging our way out of this pandemic and all the staffing shortages  is not an easy one and we do appreciate each and every one of our customers.  Thank you for coming to The Beacher Cafe

name: D Humphrey
reviews: Fantastic food and service, very friendly staff. Happy to have them open again after lockdown. Definitely a great brunch spot, especially on the patio in nice weather. Also had great late-afternoon and evening vibes for a drink or a meal. Great for families or just a couple.

name: Tarzanamann
reviews: Used to go here alot many years ago, and wanted to try it again. Very disappointed that they have no vegan options at all, and only two vegetarian options (one of which is an overpriced, basic grilled cheese). It would be so easy to offer all their burgers with the option of a veggie burger patty instead, and then they'd have several more vegetarian options at least. Or even a breakfast option that didn't include meat. I know you can get the current options without meat, but you're still paying for it.

reviews: Good food

name: mo hajiani
reviews: Ordinary brunch place.

name: Pantalaio Gaming
reviews: Love the Eggs Benedict

name: Bentley Pettipas
reviews: Unfortunately very poor service today at lunch. Our server tried her best and even apologized twice for the delay. We waited well over an hour for our meal to arrive. We were told that the steak was taking a while to cook. We were told that the BLT on a croissant would have to be on bread because they ran out of croissants. This was about 40 minutes after we had ordered it. People who arrived after us were being served long before us and several had even paid and left while we were waiting for our food. We were presented with bills that were full price. When we said we would not pay the full amount after waiting so long, we were brought bills that were 25% off. We asked to speak to a manager but we‚Äôre told no manager was working that day. We will not be returning which is hard because we know how much people are counting on getting back to normal

name: Destiny Moore
reviews: Nice chill atmosphere. Really nice staff. Totally recommend if you're in the Beaches!

name: james flannery
reviews: Loved the food, great service.

name: Natalie Taylor
reviews: This place is a local classic. The food is  always great, the service is so warm and friendly...just great.

name: Jonathan Lowe
reviews: Yummy brunch with a great patio setup

name: Laura Wise
reviews: Standard brunch fare here but its star quality comes from its location a short distance away from the beach and ambient patio. The eggs Benedict is always a great choice. Quick, friendly service.

name: Jupiter Mars
reviews: A very laid-back restaurant with a good atmosphere and impeccable service. Highly recommend it to enjoy a meal with friends at a slow pace. Then head south for a nice walk by the lake.

name: A C
reviews: Great service, food was just ok.

name: Joyce Beveridge
reviews: I did not have a good time. The server sounded too fake, and they only gave us one menu saying management doesn't allow more. We asked for a plate to share the food and we got one of the small ones. Some dishes were delicious (breakfast) and others were not (steak sandwich, caesar salad). I don't get why there is a piece of bacon on my chicken caesar salad.

name: Keegan Lee-Newbury
reviews: Food was excellent. Other than my stomach is smaller than food served, I could have finished everything!

name: Isabela Pupo Nogueira
reviews: Great food and atmosphere.

name: gwen burton
reviews: Good food, friendly staff.

name: TAIC
reviews: Great service. The all day breakfast was delicious and came in a timely manner.

name: Dave Bonifaz
reviews: Lovely restaurant!! Our first brunch out in since the panny and it was perfect! Delicious food,  great service, dog-friendly patio and clean and covid conscious!  Thank you!!

name: Abrahim Farah
reviews: When I got the coffee at Beacher Cafe it was only so-so, especially for the high price. Actually the price was not high, but you would feel it's high when tasting it.

name: Emily Ganss
reviews: Love this place. Great place to enjoy a brunch on a patio.

name: Sandra Mayors
reviews: We love serving you! Thank you so much for coming.  See you soon

name: Mike V
reviews: Just a traditional place.

name: ifariha
reviews: Excellent food and customer service.

name: Richard Bailey
reviews: It was a pleasure meeting Kumiko and staff last night. It was our first time visiting and we really enjoyed the dinner and patio. A big thank you to Kumiko for even making our dog feel welcomed. We also thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary dessert you sent us home with for Father‚Äôs Day that was a nice surprise and very thoughtful.

name: Maan Mehta
reviews: Excellent breakfast down by the beach. I am so happy The Beacher is open again!

name: Jim Adams
reviews: Great patio experience. Had perfect eggs Bennie & wonderful service.

name: Jolanta Godwod
reviews: Waitress seemed new and wasn't sure about cocktail drink options. My pina colada was just ok.  Not too many food options.  I would go back though. Patio is nice and in the beaches.

name: B Bailey
reviews: Hope it opens again

name: Dana Garden
reviews: Great food/outdoor dining in the Beaches area

name: Cynthia ‚ÄúRealtorCynthia5‚Äù Payne
reviews: One thing that really stands out for us here for us is the quality of care from the owner and our favourite server Ashley (she is some kind of wonderful).  We will never forget when we first moved in the neighbourhood, this is the first place we went to and in excitement in sharing that we just bought our new home, the owner treated our entire family to ice cream and said "welcome to the neighbourhood."  The small gesture meant so much to us as it was so genuine. Over the years, as our child was born we always felt so welcomed there and Ashely (our favourite server) had such a warm, natural rapport with our little guy and as he grew older in his tots they would always wave to eachother as they passed by. We really appreciate the community feels you create for your customers. To us you are family! Thank you for your excellence in customer service and your kindness.

name: Quad Mods FPV
reviews: Have enjoyed many breakfasts at the Beacher Cafe but have recently noticed that although the price of the menu stays the same, but the qualitty of the meals have not.  Especially the Healthy Breakfast that included a choice of avocado or cottage cheese.  The last 3 times we have been at the Beacher Cafe to support the local businesses, we have been told that the avocado is no longer available.  If the avocado is no longer available, then the price should either be lower or offer an additional poached egg.  That's my opinion!

name: Tola Firdausi
reviews: Quality of the burger is amazing! Patty is 100% premium beef that you feel on the first bite. Nice outdoor patio and staff is kind and friendly. Definitely recommend and look forward to coming back!

name: Labrador Kiko
reviews: Chicken was undercooked..dressing for salad was in one lump..so disappointed.

name: Siamak Sanati
reviews: Awesome French toast, can‚Äôt wait to go back.

name: Julie Huang
reviews: Great food and friendly service. It's also in a lovely neighbourhood so sitting on the patio was nice

name: Sarah Malito
reviews: A great outdoor place for a all day breakfast meal. Decent price and they have healthy diet menu. Good portion and friendly ambient.

name: Mark Hindle
reviews: At least the food three of us had today was not good! Very soggy Caesar salad with cheap Parmesan cheese, bad dressing, and frozen chicken strips. Prices are ok for what they sell, great location and nice view.

name: Craig Arnold
reviews: Food is not bad, about what you‚Äôd expect for a cafe. Service is OK since staff does need to align on what they say - we had bikes with us our waitress recommended we just keep with us (i.e. lean against a tree or something). Then another waitress came and told me that was unacceptable and to move the bike.

name: Kirui_Irene
reviews: Nice food but expensive for what you get. The staff are friendly but the boss is very rude and does not treat her staff well at all.

name: Carolyn Lee
reviews: Great spot for a late lunch. Good burgers.

name: Cynthia Rostie
reviews: Great food and really amazing friendly staff. Loved sitting on the patio, great atmosphere.

name: Rick Honeyford
reviews:
Great food, awesome staff.
Great setup during the pandemic

reviews: My favourite Eggs Benedict in the City of Toronto!

reviews: went for dinner today. the patio is comfortable but the food is just bad... ordered the brie cheese burger and it tasted stale. just terrible... Avoid

reviews: Adequate breakfast, no vegan options.

name: Sunil Changrani
reviews: Best place to eat in the beaches!!! And the burgers are amazing!!

name: Lana Atkins
reviews: Eggs Benny and a pop $22

name: ToyotaGeorge Sairoglou
reviews:
Whoa! That was some fun Saturday Breakfast!!! We had the all day breakfasts and eggs Florentines, four of us were amazingly satisfied when we left. The bacon was great, the eggs were done perfectly, the salad was nice and fresh, the home fries were yummy and hey! The coffee, there's something about simple black coffee that's so good when it's done well!.

We are happy! I think we found a good breakfast place we'd go to once every month or so!

Covid19- They are only offering dine in on their 5 tables outside. They take really good care of sanitation and enforce a mask policy when indoors. I appreciate the effort taken to keep employees and patrons safe.

name: Charles Godin Edgecombe
reviews: Great summer spot. The friendliest waitstaff, reasonably priced and quick service.

name: Emmanuel Gallegos
reviews: Excellent food and great service!!!  would highly recommend.  Eggs Benedict was incredible.

reviews: The food was awesome Would recommend it to anybody

name: Cheryl Parsons
reviews: Very good restaunt for families and friends totally satisfied with food and service , keep up the good work beachers cheers

name: J√∂rg-Uwe Krueger
reviews: Very nice time good service

name: Judy Saunders
reviews: I had some great soft poached eggs on top of guacamole and English muffins as a special of the day.

name: alex taylor
reviews: Best egg Benedicts I've been having for the last 30 years!

name: Bree O
reviews: They have a nice guy as a server, makes for an inviting atmosphere

name: Deb Stringer
reviews:
We stopped in to this local hotspot for the first time to have brunch. They always seem to have people inside, so we thought it would be a nice place to check out. Needless to say, we were not disappointed.
.
The food was great. We tried the all day breakfast, avocado egg benedict special, chocolate mousse cake, and an apple crumble cheesecake. Our server was exceptionally friendly, as were the other servers who checked in to provide refills of coffee or water and remove our plates.
.
The restaurant is very family-friendly. There were groups of seniors, parents with young children, couples on dates, and even a group of younger women out to brunch together. It was very welcoming and the overall experience was simply comforting.
.
I would definitely recommend stopping in to try one of their specials next time you're on Queen Street East!

name: Rebecca Wilson
reviews: Excellent food

name: Carolyn Ursabia (Caro)
reviews: Decent breakfast with nice attentive staff. Pretty pricey for what you get, but its the Beaches so that's to be expected, I suppose.

name: Sonia Gonzalez
reviews: Good! Cute little restaurant, food was good nothing to special though. Average price. Generally pretty average.

name: Maureen Smithers
reviews: One of the best restaurants in the beautiful Beaches neighborhood. The brunch is fantastic, the service is really good and the atmosphere is relaxing. We love this place.

name: Ip At
reviews: It was an excellent meal and because of my special diet they served it as I requested and wanted it. Superb!

name: Jeeya Mehta
reviews: Friendly staff and good food. Comfortable atmosphere.

name: Kelgaros
reviews: Cake was so good and service is god too

name: Robbie Buxton
reviews: Love beachers! Great french toast. A consistent breakfast place!

name: gizmatron
reviews: Great food, good service, decent beer menu, only thing holding it back is some consistency issues. Sometimes food has been amazing, sometimes only good. Manager is amazing, some of the servers are just the nicest people.

name: Brandon Kwan
reviews: Cracking breakfast

name: Junior Valler
reviews: This restaurant is in the ‚ÄòBeaches‚Äô, a very popular and beautiful neighbourhood. We were next to a large window by the street that offered a nice view. We came for brunch and I ordered Eggs Benedict. The menu said they were known for their famous hollandaise sauce. The food was great, coffee too (which is normally not the case at restaurants). Service was casual and nice but perfectly attentive when something was needed. Overall, I would eat here every morning if I could.

name: Anna J
reviews: cute place with a homey vibe and they have gluten free bread!

name: Ryan Hauck
reviews: I believe my waiters name was Rael. Tall slender man. Anyways he was the best waiter I‚Äôve ever had. Came to check up on us at the perfect time‚Äôs. 5 stars to him.

name: Azadeh Hatami
reviews: Very good.Breakfast was good.And a very nice casual atmosphere.

name: J Edwards
reviews: Delicious food

name: Amal Joseph
reviews: Personally I love it here. Just a great, simple, mom and pops restaurant.

name: HeavenlyHund
reviews: Quiet little cafe in the heart of The Beaches paradise. Good food. Wonderful staff. Amazing outdoor seating and steps from the beach! Pricey.

reviews: All of them serve us with smiling face

name: Brent Bosma
reviews: Food cold poor service 12.00 for cold chesse sandwiches and frys no salad dressing asked 3 people before I received it and never asked what kind I wanted. Veggie Burger good but forget onions and mushrooms brought in side dish cold. 150.00 4 4 chesse sandwiches 1 veggie burger 4 drinks. Sandwich was supposed to be on Texas Toast and was on thin cheap wheat toast. Was excited drove from Niagara Falls very disappointed when we got there pleasant environment. When I expressed how cold all the food was how long were you had waited and that it was incorrect toast no offer of compensation was made or apology I noticed anybody that has a complaint here many restaurants come back on with the owner of a reason complaints an offer to try to make it up so you'll come back I need to find a new restaurant in the beaches I will never return and no matter how many good reviews they have here I should just people don't go there because I don't know why anyone would give him a the food was cold the portions were small the service was poor there was high and there was a fly right around our food the entire time and nobody turn on the ceiling fans on a warm summer day to distract the flies from bothering the food. All in all a disappointing an overpriced meal. No one mines paying for a meal if the food is good in the service is nice. The only thing I can say good about this restaurant is it was cute in the inside and had a lovely patio. Don't go there if you're a vegetarian or I suspect even a meat eater and you want a good meal. Feel free to go there if you want to pay $150 for a $30 meal but isn't great. The food and service was so bad that I feel compelled to leave a very rude review and go back and edit it and add more she feeling bad about my total experience.

name: Bianca Balut
reviews:
Very pleasant and cozy atmosphere here, and the staff were genuinely kind and courteous.
I ordered the liver and onions, and was very pleased with the portion and how well it was.
I will definitely recommend this place!

name: Randy Bobandy
reviews: I had to send back my initial meal because the salad was literally swimming in a pool of oil, I just asked for a new salad with dressing on the side. I was brought a new plate and began eating to discover they had just put new salad atop the old, and the greens were literally rotting. The waitstaff was very apologetic, and it‚Äôs not her fault, but this is unacceptable for a restaurant of any kind.

name: Jessica Rodrigues
reviews: Neat spot with nice outdoor seating. I got the Brie Burger which was a delicious mess, and the spicy chipotle mayo was really tasty.

name: David Kennedy
reviews: Great food and great staff.

name: Rohit Doi
reviews: The staff was excellent! A great server who was went above and beyond! The food was great because having a proper eggs Benny is important. Only slight complaint that the hollandaise had a wee bit too much lemon juice. Other than that a good night!

name: Jennifer S
reviews: Lovely cafe, delicious food. Service was quick, the staff were friendly. Such a lovely vibe inside, would like to return soon.

name: Daniel Reynolds
reviews: good breakfast. :)

name: Seth Seegobin
reviews: Amazing food and cute place 100% would recommend anyone in the beaches area to try

name: Eric Ginestier
reviews: If it's a leisurely lunch you want, go someplace else.    Ordered a glass of white wine and began chatting with my friend.  Waiter approached three times within fifteen minutes to see if we were ready to order.  And the restaurant was close to empty!!!!!!  Ordered the tuna melts, just to get rid of the waiter.  Within five minutes he was back with the tasteless meal.  Barely luke warm melted cheese over flaked tuna on an English Muffin.  Sounds yummy.  It wasn't. Sat like a rock on my stomach because I was rushing to finish it so waiter could clear the table.  Was in and out within 40 minutes. Bad.

name: John Jukna
reviews: A very relaxing cafe just up from the beach. In my experience the cafe was never too busy and is spacious for any occasion. The food was fantastic with there being daily special boards to keep everything new. If you go in the morning Id recommend the eggs benedict and in the afternoon there brie burgers are ones not to miss out on. The staff are super friendly offering drinks at regular intervals.

name: kenny ginger
reviews: Excellent location , good food .

name: Martin Kerruish
reviews: Great service and good food!

name: Maru Garcia
reviews: Very kid friendly with a cosy but functional change table in the washroom. Always warm, welcoming and accommodating. Relaxed neighbourhood vibe with easy to find residential parking nearby. Solid comfort foods!

name: Jehu Garcia Sanchez
reviews: I don't  what  does mean BEACH BAR

name: Michal Gorecki
reviews: Excellent meal well-prepared with fantastic service.  Comfortable seating pleasant atmosphere the patio is great.

name: matt paterson
reviews:
(Translated by Google) Delicious food

(Original)
Deliciosa comida

name: Phil Hoang
reviews: Great brunch and service. The smoked salmon with scrambled eggs is actually really good. Small thin patio that is usually full for brunch but awesome for people watching along queen. But usually no wait for an inside table. Prices are reasonable.

name: Matt Drosnes
reviews: Good food, not great but worth the visit. Mostly, I go for breakfast. It has a broad outdoor patio running along its front that allows you to people watch. It‚Äôs a good place to take the kids and in my experience, it is in unusual for my coffee cup to run empty. Always a sign of a good breakfast place.  Prices are reasonable, and the staff are friendly.

name: Terence Msuku
reviews: I love this place for the nostalgia. It really feels like nothing has changed in decades. The food is good. Not great, but good. Simple old school classics, fairly priced. It's usually packed for weekend brunch and there are always arguably too many screaming children, but you can't blame the restaurant for that...

name: Mario Laroche
reviews: My rating is based on the 15 mins I was there waiting for a table at the door. It wasn't busy at all and the servers were walking slowly around all angry and annoyed. We watched two argue and it was just a disaster. We over heard people saying their orders were wrong. People went up to pay and a server yelled at them when they asked for service. I think we dodged a bullet by leaving..

name: Nuwan Perera
reviews: My favourite breakfast place in Canada.

name: Inbal Shree
reviews: We just had lunch with friends here and food was great!! Dalal is very friendly and we loved the service!!

name: La Comel
reviews: Was just there with wife and our three daughters.  Waiter was awesome and food yummy!  Will be back again

name: Tegh Mehta
reviews: Wonderful all day breakfast place with a patio

name: Ed MacDougall
reviews:
Staff is so welcoming and fun.  Good basic all day breakfast and pub food.  Drinks on the patio not to be missed.  Our server (pink pony tail) is a delight!!!
Fast service fair prices nice atmosphere
Music not too loud  great friends or family hang out

name: Matthew Thompson
reviews: Good spot for brunch and friendly staff

name: Jesse Michaels
reviews: This was good. the smothies was excellent and the eggs was well cooked...

name: Spike Lin
reviews: Ridiculously overpriced. The restaurant is cute and the fries were ok, but everything else was not very good. The benny has only two eggs but was more expensive than Sunset Grill (3 egg bennies), and much less tasty. Their ‚Äúfamous‚Äù hollandaise sauce was really weird and awful. It‚Äôs a strange colour and kind of clear, like it‚Äôs a lot of cream of tartar, and totally flavourless. I asked for an English muffin with the benny instead of a croissant but they gave me a croissant anyway and it was not a pleasant combo. The pancakes were also very bland. The amount of food they give you is TINY for the price.

name: Vincent Serban (Vicentiu)
reviews: Lovely place in the neighbourhood. I love the breakfast and the friendly staffs. Will be back when visiting the neighbourhood.

name: Rebecca H
reviews: Good and decent place

name: MHD
reviews: nice patio

name: John Mac Isaac
reviews:
Great service, good food, just no tap payment, chip only.
Classic restaurant, nice paintings on the walls.

name: Kristen Curry
reviews: Best steak sandwich ever!

name: Michael Ord
reviews: Very friendly staff, great service and food. Also serve the best french toast!

name: Susie Davis
reviews: Best homemade burgers in the city!

name: Konstantinos Chalaidopoulos
reviews: Liked it

name: Sari Goodman
reviews: I loved it! Met my childhood friend there and the food was delicious and the prices were great. The service was spectacular and the ambiance was cozy .

name: Derek Lopez
reviews: Great spot to stop and grab a bite. Excellent food, casual atmosphere and friendly staff.

name: Lee Morrow
reviews: Very nice food and friendly staff. Check their specials, they are delicious

name: Jay Kennedy
reviews: Great place for all day breakfast

name: Brian Sopher
reviews:
The breakfast here is good staff is on point in the morning. The one star is for just about the worst dinner expereince ive ever had anywhere in the world. The worst service pure rudness and unprofessional. It was almost like they didnt want us to come in.

The food was such a pale comparsion to the breakfast/brunch they do, litterly night and day. I wish i remember to take a photo, i looked at the plate and just asked for the bill. I wanted to just walk out which i should have.  "Soluvlaki chicken dinner" The plate had 5 tiny pi√®ces of chicken spread out like islands and cold fries im guessing they we're frozen?!??? It looked frost burnt.

Finally No way the owner knows this is going on. No one in there right mind would run a restaurant like this on a street with such a high reputation.

name: Jennifer Dudding
reviews: Whoa! First experience here wasn't for brunch, but for an early dinner. I had the chicken souvlaki, which was a heaping serving of perfectly cooked meat. Delicious herb roasted potatoes on the side and a Greek salad that wasn't drenched in vinegerette, excellent!  I'd known about the reputation of this restaurant for years but had never thought I'd go for dinner. Loved it. Enjoy!

name: Roman
reviews: Met a friend for coffee at this gem. Service was attentive and friendly.

name: Ciana Becker
reviews: Love the food. Prices are reasonable and the service is really good. Fantastic location right in the heart of the Beaches. Looking forward to patio season there.

name: emily
reviews: Friendly but food isn‚Äôt fresh and venue is worse for wear

name: M MT
reviews: Great family oriented restaurant with generous portions at very reasonable prices, coffee is good and the service is not quick.

name: Laetitia Walsh
reviews: Best breakfast in the Beaches

name: Karen
reviews:
Terrific restaurant. This is our GO TO place for brunch when meeting up with friends, or if we are in the area. The layout is great, and the menu is delicious. They have a lot of options, including amazing all-day breakfast!
They have terrific daily specials, and something for everyone!
I always get the Eggs Benedict on a croissant, both because I am a creature of habit, and because it is DELICIOUS!
I high recommend this restaurant!

reviews: I love their Gluten Free bread! Helena always provides wonderful service, great breakfasts and family atmosphere. I was literally looking for an escape route the 1st time I heard it, thinking a violent ex-employee was on a rampage in the kitchen. Charges for any and all substitutions really add up as well.

name: C√©line Verrier-Fletcher
reviews:
I assume that most people go here for the all day breakfast and brunch stuff but my wife and I went  here on a weekday for lunch.  We ordered some pretty simple menu items which the waitress agreed were good choices.  But for drinks we thought we would try the smoothies.  Hilarious. These were more like slushees with a fake fruit flavour and no real sign of fruit that I could see.  The arches make better smoothies.    My wife had the fish and chips and I had the club sandwich which boasts "real turkey" as an ingredient.   Sadly when the sandwich came I was hugely disappointed.  Basically three pieces of ordinary brown toast with this really thinly slice turkey that was seared on the flat top.  The peameal bacon was very thin and seared as well.  Nice lettuce and tomato but an OK effort at best.  Not recommended.   The fries on my order were fresh but had an odd odour like cheap oil... not pleasant.   My wife's fish and chips looked ok but generally we like more fish than batter.  The fish seemed a bit underdone for me.  It is again an OK effort but not terribly good.   We were given glasses of water and asked if this was tap water.  Yup.. not filtered like most restaurants today.   Yuck.. undrinkable.
I am sure this place pleases the families who come here later in the morning but I would suggest this is not really a proper restaurant for a decent meal other than the all day breakfast stuff.

name: Tyler Dias
reviews: Hi Katharine, while we appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review, we do still offer celiac friendly options. We do work with many bakeries and other kitchens who do not process gluten and those items are pre-packaged and sealed. Our house menu does process gluten and is labelled as such. Thank you again and do reach out if we can help with anything else.

reviews: Great coffee and decent vibes. There isn‚Äôt much space to sit/work, so I wouldn‚Äôt come here to study. But this place definitely serves a great flat white!

name: Zahra Rajaei
reviews:
Small, minimalistic and cute caffe with nice and friendly staff. There are not much sitting spaces but very well designed to have a calming vibe. I also love the menu as it is pretty straight forward and compartmented so you don‚Äôt need to spend half an hour to choose your order.
Their croissants was OK, not the best.

name: Anne
reviews: Such a cute, minimalistic little caf√© with great coffee and pastries. I loved the pistachio oat milk latte and croissants. All the staff are so nice, you'll feel relaxed and at home here.

reviews: Cute and compact cafe which also sells coffee beans and a small array of pastries. The pistachio latte is fantastic!

name: Grace David
reviews:
Another overpriced cafe but oh how I love it. A little sad that they only have 3 functional tables so if you are planning to go there to work, don‚Äôt. Or at-least have a backup plan. Tea was good but not worth five dollars. Pastries however, were phenomenal and I thoroughly enjoyed their raspberry croissant.

The atmospheres is really cute and service was quick and kind so I may try to come early to get a table and study for the day, but not to sure if it‚Äôs worth it.

name: Healani Norman
reviews: Very minimalistic coffee shop, I love it!!! The menu is easily compartmentalized so you're not spending twenty minutes deciding or even trying to locate what you want. I ordered the latte and my husband got the cappuccino, both of which came out with perfect micro foam. The croissant was on par being light and fluffy. We sat outside at one of the tables out front and people watched for a little while. Very lovely overall :)

name: A Dreamer (ASA)
reviews: I don‚Äôt usually go to small cafes like this (I go to big mainstream ones) but coming to this one on a whim at 8AM on a rainy morning was very cathartic. I‚Äôm not in Toronto all the time, so in a dry corner outside I spent 10 mins trying to find a cafe open, as it was 7:30am and many came up and frankly I walked the distance to a few, to which I couldn‚Äôt find and or cafes that didn‚Äôt feel right. When I saw this one I was pulled in b/c the name and honestly I‚Äôm glad I made the walking trip in the cold that morning. I had a version of a green tea White Rabbit Caffe offered & it was very bitter but that‚Äôs green tea for you üòÇ it was a big cup, I spent an hour or so here with my air buds in and I was not bothered. A place to try for the vibes, friends.

name: Jim Wallace
reviews: Good coffee, but a quite limited selection of pastries and such the day I was there. Nice place, though.

name: Tyler TM
reviews: This local coffee shop has some great stuff.  Coffee is really high quality and quite affordable.  It‚Äôs a small little place, so maybe not super idea for working/studying but there‚Äôs room if you need to.  Drink specials can run a bit on the pricier side, so I‚Äôd stick to the classics

name: Jessie C
reviews: Small and cozy cafe. Nice ambiance but limited seating. Came in to order matcha latte with oat milk and it tasted great!

name: Melissa B
reviews: I love this little spot. Great to get some work done and have a cappuccino :) Indoor and outdoor seating with good wifi. The cold tea is also good, the barista made me one with lichee and it was delicious.

name: Kathleene Sim
reviews:
I've been searching for a cafe that opens early in the morning ~7AM on weekdays so I can spend some time having breakfast before I head over to work. I'd always known this caf√© existed but I never took the leap to visit until today, and I'm really glad I took that chance.

The exterior is tiny and unassuming, but when you come in, you're invited into a small, cozy space filled with greenery in the form of decor, and lots of seating. It's a very home-y atmosphere and has this unpolished vibe to it ‚Äì I liked it; it reminded me of a cafe I used to visit while in school.

I ordered a lavender latte and pistachio croissant. The barista was kind and helpful with describing the lavender latte, as I had some concerns. They were also able to sub in oat milk, as I'm a bit lactose intolerant.

I love lavender in theory, but any strong aromas of it truthfully turns me away. The latte I got was like the idea of lavender; the flavour was definitely there, but in a really subtle way, which is how I'd hoped it to be. The pistachio croissant was GREAT. They really didn't skimp on that filling.

I'll be back soon to try the rest of the menu!

name: Tiffany Santos
reviews: Highly recommend the lavender and pistachio latte!

name: Adel B
reviews:
Dissapointing experience. The drinks are very watered down, and the lids don't even fit properly so it spills when you try to drink which stained my pants.

In addition, although there are straws, they don't give you them and they don't even fit.

I hope this business improves because it definitely does not deserve over 2 stars...

name: F J Iturralde
reviews: Awesome service. Great presentation. Nice Aesthetics. Good coffee. Good Pastries. If Ethan is in there, you'll have a great service.

name: Megan Fleming
reviews: Friendly experience and DELICIOUS iced lavender latte! I was excited to check out this caf√© when I learned it had zero plastic, but it seems their to-go iced drinks cups are not zero plastic. I have been to other caf√©s with to-go iced drink cups that look like plastic but are indeed compostable, but this one has a recyclable symbol. I'd go back for a hot drink or to eat-in, but I was disappointed that their iced drink cups are not plastic-free despite being a zero plastic caf√©.

name: Ramya Gudipudi
reviews: Ordered oat latte but had weird after taste for some reason, not sure it‚Äôs with espresso or oat milk. Not interested to visit again!

name: Mk Bru
reviews: quality lattes every time. highly skilled baristas. looking forward to my next visit!

name: Marina Galeano
reviews: I was hoping to try the pastries, but learned they are not vegan or plant-based üòï ‚Ä¶

Update:
Pistachio latte is amazing. The croissants are great too!

reviews: This cafe is awesome! The owner is great and very responsive to anything you said to him about the food or drinks. He and the store itself were some of my fav things about that neighborhood when I lived there. So much better than Timmies. Keep it up!!

name: Payam Emadi
reviews: Nice spot

name: Adam Schneider
reviews: I‚Äôd give this place 10 stars if I could. For one thing, the espresso was great, and every americano or latte or flat white I got was perfect. For another, the owner (who was most often the person behind the counter when we went in) was a breath of fresh air - one of the few people in the city who was friendly, personable, and treated my wife and me as human beings. He‚Äôd always smile, chat, and he remembered our orders and things we told him. People often talk about ‚Äúlocal gems‚Äù and this place is the dictionary definition of that term. If I hadn‚Äôt left the city, I‚Äôd be there every day.

reviews: Quant cafe with indoor and outdoor seating. Tasty croissants and coffee. They have milk alternatives for those who prefer

name: Timothy K
reviews:
The White Rabb was really missing "it" (see photo).

The most disappointing part of this coffee shop was that it has high reviews (4.7) at the time of writing this. In reality this is a 2-3 star coffee shop. The flat white was overly milky and technically a latte -I would say it fell flat. The google listing writes "sandwiches and salads" but middle of the day they only had like, 5-6 croissants to chose from and there was a fly on them. If you want to eat, go elsewhere.

Edit: Saw the owner's reply below, unfortunately the review wasn't written the same day as the experience took place so I doubt the "barista in training" excuse (also because I only saw one employee on site that day (Tuesday Oct 12th, app. 11:30am) and I'm fairly certain the barista that served us was the owner) and, I do appreciate the offer of a free coffee but we had come to the establishment for the sandwiches and salads, hopefully you guys will have that in the future.

In LOVE with this place and their lavender latte!!!

reviews: I love this place. I've visited from time to time over the past year, and they haven't let me down yet. Espresso was smooth, rich, and ever so slightly tart. It's perfect. reviews: One of the best places for coffee in the city! Coffee is great! Desserts are decadent and amazing. My friend says ‚Äúdamn good lemonade‚Äù. Been here three times and I have never been disappointed. This will has been my new coffee place since Coffee Public moved.

name: Sally Chung
reviews: Cute little cafe! Loved the interior. Also picked up the last two pastries that were available with my coffee - one was an apple croissant and the other a donut and I didn't regret it!

name: Andrew Gong
reviews: I take a longer walk to this cafe because of the unique latte flavors that are not usually offered at other cafes, such as pistachio latte. I personally like their patio because though located on Bay Street, there‚Äôs not much foot/car traffic, especially as the sidewalk is wide on this portion of Bay Street. However, the patio is less ideal for patrons who prefer more shading from the sun as there isn‚Äôt much shading for most seats.

name: David Yazbeck
reviews: Fantastic service - and even better coffee!

name: Michelle Ly
reviews: Love their iced apple espresso

name: Brendan Daw
reviews: Pastries are good, coffee is fine, but staff hasn't been very pleasant all three times I've been here.

name: Kaylie Towne
reviews: Stopped by for a lavender latte and it was *chefs kiss*. As a coffee fanatic, I will definitely be back for more! The service was great as well. Definitely worth it and happy to support this gem of a local business.

name: Bindu
reviews: Places that don't want to serve customers same quality of coffee during a promotion shouldn't participate in them. I was shopping around for a coffee shop that I could frequent, ordered an iced coffee from Ritual and got a watered down, weak drink. Went to Mos Mos just down the road that seems to know the point of promotions: to induce patronage. Which they did successfully. I'll buying my iced coffee and Bloomers' donuts at Mos Mos in the future

They have a huge variety of various specialty lattes available (I tried the vanilla, and want to get the pistachio next time!) My boyfriend also purchased some of their coffee beans which he was very pleased with as well!

name: Ryan W
reviews: Super awesome Iced Americano.!!

name: Leo Twin Flame
reviews: I call this place the diamond caf√© of Toronto. I usually walk 10 min on my break from my office to get their refreshing tea, coffee and lat√©. The service is professional and they are very friendly. Always having a great experience there. I can confidently say, it's one of my best coffee shops in town! You need to try it to know what I'm talking about. I forgot Tim Hortons and Starbucks after discovering this place üëèüëç‚ù§

name: Rupica Sudan (DineInToronto)
reviews: Sucha a cute little spot. The service is fantastic and the coffee is delish!

name: Sabrina A
reviews: This is the best coffee shop in the area! Every drink I've tried has been amazing (the pistachio latte is definitely my fave), and the owners are always so pleasant and sweet. I try not to go out for my coffee too often, but when I need a treat, White Rabbit is the place to go!

name: Eszter Mark√≥
reviews: Had a great experience in White Rabbit Caffe. Currently they‚Äôre offering Brazilian beans for espresso, roasted by Hatch. The barista is friendly, communicative and professional; he took his time to provide an exceptional shot while he was maintaining a conversation with me. I‚Äôm confident that I‚Äôll visit this coffee shop more often. #supportlocal

name: Vincent Tse
reviews: I‚Äôm no coffee expert but this place deserves all the praise it gets. I highly recommend the pistachio latte and the mocha latte. Has a higher price tag but worth it as this is the best latte I‚Äôve had in a long time.

name: Katie Rook

name: Stephanie Schreiber

The inside is small but good take out. The pastries are good too. Not sure is fresh baked but it has nice and tender.
Supporting local business.

reviews: Friendly, personable and knowledgable staff in a clean and warm space. Latte was a tasty treat.

name: Chosen 1s
reviews: TOP NOTCH PASTRIES SATISFACTION GUARANTEED...

name: C
reviews: Looks like people love this cafe, but most people comment about the flavoured lattes. When it‚Äôs regular latte it‚Äôs super sour to me? Is it just me? Flavoured lattes drinkers won‚Äôt be able to tell as the syrup masks the sourness. But it‚Äôs seriously so sour.

name: Lorraine Lomongo
reviews: Delicious coffee

name: Crystal M
reviews: Such a nice shop. The best lattes. Go support this great independent ‚ù£Ô∏è

name: em ily
reviews: The owner of this cafe can be very nice. I have been pre-COVID and he is very keen to engage every one of his customers. That being said, post-COVID I have been semi-terrified by his utter lack of respect for the guidelines. The last five times I have passed by or gone into the store to get something the man has his mask either not covering his nostrils or not covering his mouth at all! I have seen other reviewers mention this behavior and also seen the owner reply with an excuse like "you came in when the cafe was empty" but he definitely still does this when plenty of people are in the store. I definitely go less than I did before COVID because of this behaviour. There are plenty of other cafes that are rule-abiding and that have products that are just as good.

name: Ankit Kumar
reviews: Best Cappuccino in town!!

name: Yuki Dawn
reviews: Love it üòç love it üòç loooooove it , as someone who‚Äôs caffeine addict, this  place is the best ‚Ä¶

name: John Q

name: Chap

name: m usman
reviews: White Rabbit Caffe is a nice caf√© to visit I visited White Rabbit Caffe on Tuesday I loved the food Ambiance is great as well Greeat Service

name: Kasthury Mathi
reviews: I love everything about this place from service, latte and atmosphere

name: William Khalil
reviews:
2020.10.05. Our visit to White Rabbit is becoming a ritual. A great one. All the family loves their coffee ... Hot Americano and Iced Americano. Thank you @snapturethis for the initial recommendation to visit White Rabbit and for the special coffee display of lovely coffee prints by @snapturethis (you should visit the place, try their coffee, and see the prints). We support local businesses. We love coffee.

2020.08.24. Our second coffee of the day was a visit to a favorite coffee place "White Rabbit Cafe Toronto". Our family is specialized in coffee tasting. We visit and drink a lot of coffee at many places. This place is a top scorer. Try their coffee you will not regret it. We sat outside and it was very pleasant.  Bravo WRCT.

name: Marcela Romero
reviews:
Excellent espresso and cookies!
The owner is lovely

name: Karishma Rane
reviews: My go to place for coffee, great staff

name: Heather Davison
reviews: LAVENDER latte. DELICIOUS!  Enjoyed w/ a pistachio croissant.  I don't even like pistachios (their yummy edibles sell out fast) and I was late in the day.  Wow loved it!  Who knew.  This place is cozy, super cute, delicious.  Great to sit, work, chat, inside or out.  5 stars for White Rabbit.   I'm a regular now. : ))

name: Toby Whitfield
reviews: Great coffee, but yikes for COVID risk. This place is tiny, and shouldn't have tables, as those using them are unmasked. The server had his mask pulled down over his chin, with mouth and nose totally exposed, and no other physical barrier. Unfortunately it is good coffee, because I'm not going back to expose myself needlessly.

name: Janette Nicholson
reviews: Such a lovely little spot with unique blends.  Try the psatacio latte....you will not be disappointed.

name: Emily L.
reviews: I visited this place after my friends recommended to me. I tried their pistachio latte and it was by far, the best one I've ever tried. Also loved the atmosphere and the interior design. I felt warm and was welcomed by friendly staff. All of these factors led me to visiting the place 3 times out of the 6 days I was in Toronto!

name: Liron Bar
reviews: We had brunch with the blubbery lemonade and latte and it was delicious well done guys, perfect service.

name: Ethan Horbay
reviews:
Exquisite food at easy price.
The most beautiful place -- gotta feel the love here!

name: M K
reviews:
Cute cafe opened on Bay St (north of Gerrard). The interior is beautiful. I have spoken to the owner a number of times and he put so much effort and thought into the design of this place. The pastries look amazing, I have tried the butter croissant. The espresso is great. I could sit here for hours! There is wifi. They are no plastic! They have oatmilk for your drinks for free. The bathroom is super cute too and so clean. A must go in the area!

Update: Owner has added a patio, which is excellent especially during COVID. Wifi reaches table outside (close to window) which is great!

name: Mohamad Ali Fakih
reviews: one of the best coffee shops in the city , few shops around toronto that serves this grade of coffee beans or get this creative with their drinks. whether you try their coffee , pastries , veggie bowls or chicken sandwiches you wont be disappointed , top that with great and friendly service, I definitely recommend visiting this place + its clean and cozy

name: Rene Quevedo
reviews: Cute little coffee shop. I had a pistachio latte which was incredible!

name: Shamim Forouzan Boroujeni
reviews:
(Translated by Google) A good coffee with finesse. Attentive service at a good price.

(Original)
Un bon caf√© avec de la finesse. Un service attentionn√© √† bon prix.

name: Dmitry Romanenko
reviews:
Decent coffee, friendly atmosphere, amazing Barista. Coffee beans are having very rich taste that remind me of Black Canary beans. Thumbs up!

I have concerns about quite small space inside. There's probably no point to fit so many tables and chairs inside if you can't let people sit so close in current pandemic realities. This space instead could be reliably used for waiting area.

name: Chaitanya ‚ÄúChai‚Äù Narula
reviews: This is my favorite place in the area. First and foremost, the coffee is absolutely amazing and to top it off, the owner sources some top quality baked goodies. The mugs are unprinted, stamped and compostable. He uses organic, really good quality milk and is just a great person to have a quick conversation while the fresh brew is prepared.

name: Chan A.
reviews: One of the best coffee in town!

name: Daisy Xu
reviews: Small cafe

name: Mohamed Khamis
reviews: Very nice coffee with plenty of options. Ibrahim was excellent in the way he presented their options and recommended great flavors for us. Highly recommend trying their pistachio coffee!

name: Charlotte hung
reviews: Amazing coffee and baked goodies. The owner is extremely nice and knows his coffee for sure! It's been my go-to spot since quarantine:)

name: Ilias Ettayebi
reviews: Great coffee and great service. The iced pistachio latte was really good! Highly recommend checking this place out.

name: Sarah Manori
reviews: Great coffee, delicious pastries and friendly owner! Loved it

name: Matt Collins
reviews: Great new local spot for delicious coffee, beans and cookies. Highly recommended for anyone living and working near college park!

name: Phoenix Kiula
reviews: Excellent coffee. Great to have this as an option to Hailed in the neighborhood. The coffee bean could be fuller bodied. It seems Canadians like their coffee mild. I miss the coffee from Sydney. The barista seems to be the owner too and he‚Äôs a master of the making art: each cup is meticulously made. The blueberry croissant is gorgeous. If the coffee itself was a bit stronger this would be a 5 star in my book.

name: Elizabeth Selezneva
reviews: Awesome place !!! Serve cool , unusual drinks ! The owner is cute too !

name: John Stathman
reviews: We tried the fabulous fresh orang juice with a shot of espresso. It is really a different experience and taste. Boost your power and feel fresh by trying it.

name: Erin Zeiadin
reviews: Unbelievable coffee that I will drive across the city for. The owner is incredibly knowledgeable and the nicest person to chat with. Can't go wrong with  any drink or food option here!

name: Vlada Laryna
reviews: The best coffee in Toronto

name: alex salavarrieta
reviews: The coffee and service are exceptional great place to be at any time of the day @chicsophistic and @ok_kovtun recommend it 10 starts

name: Annette Boissonneault
reviews:
Thanks to be open!
And on top of that offer a great Cappucino!!
Will be back!!‚òï

name: Jenna Brown
reviews: They make the BEST oat milk latte in the city and have lots of vegan options, which are DELICIOUS! Always great service from the owner, and is a beautiful spot to sit and work or catch up with friends

name: Ishrat Trishna
reviews: This is an exceptional little cafe! The cozy and welcoming decor is what drew me in on a grey, windy day. The owner is fun to chat with and the drinks were phenomenal. I had a latte and my husband had a hit chocolate and both were top notch! I'm so excited to be a patron here hopefully for a long time to come.

name: Pranay Garg
reviews: White rabbit is the place to be! I love the coffee here. Amazing coffee, fresh ingredients. Unlike many popular chains the shop uses real ground coffee instead of chocolate syrups for mocha and it has quickly become my favourite. I have also grown a liking to pistachio latte, a coffee with notes of pistachio mixed in latte and a wonderful aftertaste. Wether you need your daily coffee fix or looking to elevate your experience of drinking coffee, white rabbit is your place!

name: Ben
reviews:
The owner and staff are the nicest people!
Products 5/5
Quality 5/5
Vibe 5/5

name: AJ Brown
reviews: A lovely little coffee shop

name: Davis Town
reviews: (2020-04-10) Best coffee shop in the area. High quality beans and milk. Fantastic pastries. Marble decor. Plants everywhere. Friendly owner. Love the atmosphere.

name: Hanna Gry
reviews: Cozy new coffee shop in the area. Not to big, but really a great place to meet up with friends. My oat milk matcha latte was great. Their croissants looks aaaamazing. Salads and sandwiches are also available.

name: Sehran Hasanli
reviews: Very friendly staff and excellent coffee and pistachio croissants!

name: Leon P
reviews: Excellent service and friendly staff.

name: Sergei Makarov
reviews:
Please either change your hours or don't close 15 minutes earlier. I went to your place at 19:45 today and the barista was already closing the cafe because "there were no clients for the last hour". Two other people arrived at the same time and also were turned away. Very frustrating experience.
Otherwise the place is great, pastries are especially good.

name: Carter Newman
reviews: Amazing espresso, all takeout items are compostable, chill and knowledgable staff, all around fantastic place. Also: daily features!

name: Nick Tsergas
reviews: Cuuuuuute little spot. Friendly staff and good coffee. A well-deserved five stars.

name: Henry Ko
reviews: Beautiful Interior, cute study space. Ordered a Oat Milk Latte and a Blueberry & Earl Grey croissant and it was delicious!

name: Olivia Fortenbacher
reviews: Excellent tea latte, and bonus points for a completely compostable cup!

name: Mina Yumen
reviews: I am so happy we have a local coffee shop in the area! Very friendly team and good products made with love.

name: Abe
reviews: Wowww,  this place is a hit.  Finally a coffee that you can savour. The staff amazing, pastries and food is out of this world.  Cant wait to go back to this nice welcoming caffe. Cheers and all the best.

name: Morgan Dobroshinsky
reviews: This is a great new addition to downtown! The staff are SO kind and attentive, and make an amazing oat milk latte. And the Banana Nutella Danish? Delish! Will definitely be back soon!

name: Rebecca Wilkinson
reviews: Super cute little cafe on Bay street that serves up 10/10 espressos and great pastries (the pistachio croissants are especially amazing). They also serve a bunch of vegan or vegetarian options for lunch like veggie bowls and sandwiches. It's a nicely designed and cozy spot to sit down and hang out in if you are in the area.

name: Bretton Newman
reviews: Great decor, delicious coffee and don‚Äôt leave without a pistachio croissant! I‚Äôve heard they sell out daily so get one before they‚Äôre gone.

name: Alexander Lam
reviews: Had a Cortado, great flavour. Decor/ambience is nice. Would reccomend
